Answer from Nitya Agrawal


n/=10 means n=n/10. Its a shorthand method to divide n with 10. For example: if n=20, then n/=10 would answer 2.

Question: Why do we use % in C++?


Answer from Saurabh


% is modulo operator in c++, which basically computes the remainder when n1 is divided by n2.

i.e.

[code]10%3 = 1;  // 3*3 + 1
10%2 = 0;  // 2*5 + 0
[/code]

Subject: You can eliminate your lust.
Message:
View this post on the web at https://improvebypathsofstoicism.substack.com/p/you-can-eliminate-your-lust

Lust, in its simplest form, is intense desire. It’s human, it’s natural, and it’s wired into us. But when it gets out of hand, it can throw us off track in more ways than we realize.
We live in a world where we’re constantly bombarded with things designed to pull at our desires—social media, advertising, the endless pursuit of “more.” From the envy we feel over someone’s seemingly perfect life on Instagram to the impulse to buy that trendy gadget or try to impress others, these things spark lust in many forms. When we let these desires run unchecked, they drain our time, focus, and energy—taking us away from what we truly want to achieve.
Thanks for reading The improvement journal! Subscribe for free to receive new posts and support my work.
Lust in excess can feel like a constant pull, one that clouds our judgment and nudges us into impulsive decisions. Over time, these distractions can lead to regret as we lose sight of our long-term goals for short-lived satisfaction. If we want to live a life of focus and purpose, learning to recognize and manage these desires is essential.
The Problem with Excessive Lust
Every moment you spend distracted by an urge is a moment you’re not dedicating to something meaningful. Lust clouds judgment, makes us act on impulse, and shifts our priorities. When these desires turn into a craving for instant gratification, they often leave us feeling empty afterward—because the satisfaction is only temporary.
How to Keep Lust in Check
So how do we get control over these desires before they control us? Here’s a closer look at five practical steps:
Recognize the Feeling and Pause
The first step to controlling lust is simply noticing it when it shows up. Say you’re scrolling on social media and suddenly feel the urge to look up your ex’s profile, or maybe you get a sudden itch to buy something expensive you don’t need. When you feel that rush, take a moment to pause.
This pause isn’t about judgment; it’s about giving yourself the chance to reflect. Ask yourself, “Why am I feeling this? Is this going to benefit me in the long run?” Pausing gives you a chance to make a conscious decision rather than an impulsive one. Over time, even a brief pause will help you respond to desires more thoughtfully.
Refocus on Your Goals
When you’re clear on your life goals, the things that matter become your “north star.” If your main focus is improving your health or building a new skill, for example, you’ll have less room for distractions. Take a few minutes each day to remind yourself why you’re on this journey of improvement. Whether that’s to feel healthier, achieve career growth, or just enjoy more peace, reflecting on your bigger goals will help filter out distractions.
So next time you feel pulled by an urge, think about how your choice will impact those goals. Will it push you closer, or pull you away? This refocus brings purpose back into your decisions and gives you clarity.
Practice Self-Discipline Daily
Discipline is like a muscle; it grows stronger with daily use. The more we practice self-control in small, everyday decisions, the more naturally we can resist bigger urges when they come up. Start with small habits, like committing to a short workout every day, setting a regular time to read, or limiting screen time before bed.
Each time you follow through on these little promises to yourself, you reinforce the ability to say “no” when bigger distractions come along. Over time, these small acts of discipline add up and make resisting larger temptations less of a struggle.
Limit Triggers
We all have certain triggers—whether it’s scrolling through social media, watching certain content, or hanging around people who encourage distractions. For example, if you notice that certain apps make you crave validation or stir up unhealthy comparisons, consider setting time limits or muting notifications.
When you limit the things that spark desire, you create more room for peace and focus. This doesn’t mean cutting out all distractions overnight. Instead, start by setting boundaries around one or two habits. Reducing your exposure to triggers bit by bit makes a big difference.
Channel Desire into Positive Outlets
Desire isn’t a bad thing—it’s just energy looking for a place to go. So instead of trying to shut it down entirely, why not redirect it? For example, if you find yourself craving excitement, maybe it’s time to start a new hobby or get into a fitness routine that challenges you. This kind of redirection channels the energy of desire into something beneficial.
By giving yourself something meaningful to focus on, like a personal project, a workout goal, or learning a new skill, you’ll find that other distractions naturally lose their grip. Channeling energy into positive outlets brings a sense of accomplishment and pride that can easily outweigh fleeting urges.
The Big Picture
Ultimately, controlling lust is about becoming the master of your own mind. It’s about deciding that your time, energy, and focus are too valuable to waste on distractions. When you take back that control, you’ll find that life becomes richer, clearer, and more fulfilling.
Remember: our biggest distractions often reveal what we need to work on most. By taking control of our desires, we open the door to more purpose, peace, and long-term happiness.
Stay focused and keep moving forward. You’ve got this!
Best,
pathsofstoicism.

The Ultimate DevOps Developer Roadmap
Programming Languages
Pick and master one or two programming languages. Choose from options like Python, JavaScript, Go, Ruby, etc.
Operating Systems
Master the ins and outs of major operating systems like Linux, Windows, Mac, and so on.
Source Control Management
Learn about source control management tools such as Git, GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket.
Networking
Master the basics of networking concepts such as DNS, IP, TCP, and SSH.
CI/CD
Pick tools like GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or CircleCI to learn about continuous integration and continuous delivery.
Scripting and Terminals
Learn scripting in bash, and PowerShell along with knowledge of various terminals and editors.
Hosting and Platforms
Master multiple hosting platforms such as AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, Digital Ocean, Lambda, Azure Functions, etc.
Infrastructure as Code
Learn infrastructure as code tools like Terraform, Pulumi, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Kubernetes, etc.
Monitoring and Logging
Master the key tools for monitoring and logging for infrastructure and applications such as Prometheus, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana, etc.
Basics of Software Development
Learn the basics of software development such as system availability, data management, design patterns, and team collaboration.
Over to you: What else would you add to this roadmap?

The New Relic Intelligent Observability Platform, transforms observability from ensuring uptime and reliability into a key driver of business growth and developer velocity for enterprises worldwide. With new innovations such as New Relic AI and GitHub Copilot integration, New Relic Pathpoint Plus for business observability, and New Relic Retail Solution.
The Ultimate Redis 101
Redis is one of the most popular data stores in the world and is packed with features.
Here are 8 simple steps that can help you understand the fundamentals of Redis.
What is Redis?
Redis (Remote Dictionary Server) is a multi-modal database that provides sub-millisecond latency. The core idea behind Redis is that a cache can also act as a full-fledged database.
Redis Adoption
High-traffic internet websites like Airbnb, Uber, Slack, and many others have adopted Redis in their technology stack.
How Redis Changed the Database Game?
Redis supported main memory read/writes while still supporting fully durable storage. Read and writes are served from the main memory but the data is also persisted to the disk. This is done using snapshots (RDB) and AOF.
Redis Data Structures
Redis stores data in key-value format. It supports various data structures such as strings, bitmaps, lists, sets, sorted sets, hash, JSON, etc.
Basic Redis Commands
Some of the most used Redis commands are SET, GET, DELETE, INCR, HSET, etc. There are many more commands available.
Redis Modules
Redis modules are add-ons that extend Redis functionality beyond its core features. Some prominent modules are RediSearch, RedisJSON, RedisGraph, RedisBloom, RedisAI, RedisTimeSeries, RedisGears, RedisML, and so on.
Redis Pub/Sub
Redis also supports even-driven architecture using a publish-subscribe communication model.
Redis Use Cases
Top Redis use cases are Distributed Caching, Session Storage, Message Queue, Rate Limiting, High-Speed Database, etc.
Over to you: What else will you add to get a better understanding of Redis?
6 Software Architectural Patterns You Must Know
Choosing the right software architecture pattern is essential for solving problems efficiently.
Layered Architecture
Each layer plays a distinct and clear role within the application context. 
Great for applications that need to be built quickly. On the downside, source code can become unorganized if proper rules aren’t followed
Microservices Architecture
Break down a large system into smaller and more manageable components.
Systems built with microservices architecture are fault tolerant. Also, each component can be scaled individually. On the downside, it might increase the complexity of the application.
Event-Driven Architecture
Services talk to each other by emitting events that other services may or may not consume.
This style promotes loose coupling between components. However, testing individual components becomes challenging
Client-Server Architecture
It comprises two main components - clients and servers communicating over a network.
Great for real-time services. However, servers can become a single point of failure.
Plugin-based Architecture
This pattern consists of two types of components - a core system and plugins. The plugin modules are independent components providing a specialized functionality.
Great for applications that have to be expanded over time like IDEs. However, changing the core is difficult.
Hexagonal Architecture
This pattern creates an abstraction layer that protects the core of an application and isolates it from external integrations for better modularity. Also known as ports and adapters architecture.
On the downside, this pattern can lead to increased development time and learning curve.
Over to you: Which other architectural pattern have you seen?
Top Eventual Consistency Patterns You Must Know
Eventual consistency is a data consistency model that ensures that updates to a distributed database are eventually reflected across all nodes. Techniques like async replication help achieve eventual consistency.
However, eventual consistency can also result in data inconsistency. Here are 4 patterns that can help you design applications.
Pattern#1 - Event-based Eventual Consistency
Services emit events and other services listen to these events to update their database instances. This makes services loosely coupled but delays data consistency.
Pattern#2 - Background Sync Eventual Consistency
In this pattern, a background job makes the data across databases consistent. It results in slower eventual consistency since the background job runs on a specific schedule.
Pattern#3 - Saga-based Eventual Consistency
Saga is a sequence of local transactions where each transaction updates data with a single service. It is used to manage long-lived transactions that are eventually consistent.
Pattern#4 - CQRS-based Eventual Consistency
Separate read and write operations into different databases that are eventually consistent. Read and write models can be optimized for specific requirements.
Over to you: Which other eventual consistency patterns have you seen?

Subject: Prepaid Card Statement - for 10/2024 - 4135XXXXXXXX6011
Message:
Dear AYUSH POKHAEL 

Please find attached your monthly prepaid card statement for 10/2024 

In order to enhance the security of your personal information, we have encrypted your statement with a password.

Your password hint to open the PDF file is FIRST FOUR ALPHABETS OF YOUR FIRST NAME + FIRST FOUR ALPHABETS OF YOUR LAST NAME+ LAST FOUR NUMBER OF YOUR MOBILE NUMBER.

For Example: Customer name is HARI PRASAD SHARMA and mobile number is 9841000000, then password will be harishar0000. Customer name is RAM PRASAD SHARMA and mobile number is 9841000000, then password will be ramshar0000. 

Note: Password is case sensitive, please use lower case.

ATTN: Please do not reply to this email. This mailbox is not monitored and you will not receive a response.

If you have any queries, Please contact us at: 
NABIL Bank Ltd. 
Card Division, Durbar Marg 
Kathmandu, Nepal 
Phone # +977-1-4223125, 4227181 
Email: card@nabilbank.com

Subject: 🎉 T-7 Days! HackUMass XII is Almost Here
Message:
Hi Ayush,

We’re hyped to have you at HackUMass from Nov 8th-10th! Before we kick off, here are two quick things you need to do:
- RSVP on the Dashboard: Haven’t RSVP’d yet? Do it now at dashboard.hackumass.com to get your QR code for check-in. 🎟️
- Join Our Discord: This is your go-to hub for updates, finding teammates, and event support. Don’t miss out! 💬 [https://u46976522.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.jgS1aaU7WTsFXZyNZqevQBkm8nqMKZjBT7KTfQ0QERJWnlLMmNLJR8n-2FkSgJK-2BZSj-GH_Jaai3hjBhCCmSgaW3FR0XxfgpvY-2F2gq5OHvJedGChiSOSw239KbhhrpfqE2e7DarCfK2P0K7u-2FYvyr-2BYij1IRKDunt0SYKljgEkjKiO8eGA2MPi-2BBMQPB7gFTz1ktUdxG-2BrLPVH-2FzIzKuJPhZkE6UkaxWrAa6MAXN8rdk3CippxnDckhdyGbZuNAijU48I-2BL6NH30H5s38IGNi2UDu16jQ-3D-3D]

Subject: Java resources for you!
Message:
Explore endless resources to jumpstart your progress.



 <https://www.mongodb.com/>


Hey Ayush,


Welcome to MongoDB Atlas, a developer data platform that provides an 
integrated suite of data and application infrastructure. Build for virtually 
any type of application with support in Atlas for transactional, full-text 
search, vector search, stream processing, and more.




Java resources for you



 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/quickstarts/>

Quickstarts <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/quickstarts/>


 New to building with MongoDB and Java? Check out our Quickstart guides for 
step-by-step instructions for your first Java project on MongoDB.



Quickstart for Java CRUD Operations > 
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/java-setup-crud-operations/>







 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/tutorials/> 

Tutorials <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/tutorials/>


Ready to tackle more advanced Java use cases with MongoDB? Check out our 
tutorials.



Tutorial on Client-Side Encryption Using Spring Data MongoDB > 
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/products/atlas/mongodb-atlas-search-with-java-part1/>







 <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/videos/>

Videos <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/videos/>


 Check out our latest YouTube videos to get expert guidance on building with 
Java and MongoDB.



Learn more > <https://www.mongodb.com/developer/languages/java/videos/>







 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/catalog?labels=%5B%22Language%22%5D&values=%5B%22Java%22%5D>

MongoDB University 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/catalog?labels=%5B%22Programming%20Language%22%5D&values=%5B%22Java%22%5D>


Try our free, interactive online courses to learn the basics of building a 
modern Java application on MongoDB.



Get started > 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/catalog?labels=%5B%22Programming%20Language%22%5D&values=%5B%22Java%22%5D>




 







MongoDB Atlas + Amazon Web Services (AWS) 
<https://www.mongodb.com/mongodb-on-aws>



Build sophisticated, enterprise-ready GenAI-powered applications with MongoDB 
Atlas and Amazon Web Services (AWS).



Learn more > <https://www.mongodb.com/mongodb-on-aws>

Subject: Anusa Gyanwali shared a post:…
Message:
Anusa Gyanwali shared a post: Celebrating 4 Amazing Years of Growth, Innovation & Success!

From our humble beginnings to where we stand today, it’s been a journey filled with incredible growth, resilience, and boundless achievements.
Over the past four years, we have:
✨ Welcomed new talents and built a powerhouse team
✨ Launched innovative projects that challenged the norm
✨ Created impactful partnerships and connections worldwide
✨ Stayed committed to our core values of integrity, creativity, and customer satisfaction
This milestone wouldn't be possible without the dedication of our team, the trust of our clients, and the unwavering support from our partners. Here's to all of you who have been a part of this journey with us — thank you for helping us reach this incredible milestone.
Devfinity NOW CFO

Subject: Everything you'll need to know from MLH at HackTX 💻
Message:
MLH Logo ( http://email2click.mlh.io/ls/click?upn=u001.RdozofatWF2I0U8RNZ0g-2BgomgOD8l0Mu7xEl-2FUp4E24-3Duyej_Jaai3hjBhCCmSgaW3FR0XxfgpvY-2F2gq5OHvJedGChiT8-2Fzeo-2FQOMefbI2s4gSL7LdIwBxm6PtafxfPZtl4uBNQcDVXyEPH84sCSE1wdJJCGgv2dL31oJt-2B-2B4oaMHl2Q4cuLdUCrG6S5HI-2Bp-2B5qK27phX3pEDFYRk-2F58J5fWBbGCitvwp6z304ablBJGMaTAptJhSUhz5DPvteQgKc-2Fp7PPNe1ftTZb0mpqQHY02hLAGUfz8h3B-2FqiqCDpf6xAYli7O8AJNVtFLv3EKE7eHnvpZKji8MrkQUblNAbBL9l6WA-3D )

Hey, Ayush --

Figma Dev Mode is a new Figma feature designed to create smoother collaboration between designers and developers, as well as empower hackers to level up their own design-skills.  

Whether you're completely new to designing websites or want to expand your skill set, this workshop is a great way to learn one of the most developer friendly and professionally utilized design tools on the market! 

Don't forget to signup for a Figma student account ( http://email2click.mlh.io/ls/click?upn=u001.RdozofatWF2I0U8RNZ0g-2BgjSfOarJSAyhgQxnSIanlk-3DZFf4_Jaai3hjBhCCmSgaW3FR0XxfgpvY-2F2gq5OHvJedGChiT8-2Fzeo-2FQOMefbI2s4gSL7LdIwBxm6PtafxfPZtl4uBNQcDVXyEPH84sCSE1wdJJCGgv2dL31oJt-2B-2B4oaMHl2Q4cuLdUCrG6S5HI-2Bp-2B5qK27phX3pEDFYRk-2F58J5fWBbGDaQmQjkUwyieGPU0qF8m2ArRE0xqr2f0EXqUAQOPBU-2B7O4WN-2B6QNTF2hxkoL74bcW2zHRWfTl1goEMyNZYVUlObKOBWsgkQt5zU7I1RVFQzeC8kOSivNd50GdAWPtUwRQ-3D ) to get free access to Figma Dev Mode.

It feels like January was just yesterday, doesn’t it? But here we are—October is wrapping up, and we’re standing at the edge of November. There are just 60 days left in 2024. Sixty days to think back on the goals you set in January and see what you've achieved, where you’re still working, and where you’ve lost traction. 
           “The best time to start was yesterday. The next best time is now.”
This isn’t a message to make you feel guilty about what you haven't done, nor is it meant to rush you to fit everything into these last two months. Instead, this is a wake-up call, a gentle reminder that you still have time—60 days, to be exact.
Reflecting on Your Year: What Have You Achieved?
Let’s start with some reflection. Take a moment, wherever you are, to consider how you spent this year. What were your big wins? What habits have you built that you’re proud of? What about those habits that didn't stick as well as you'd hoped?
Maybe you started strong but somewhere along the line, lost focus. Maybe life threw unexpected challenges your way. Or maybe, you’re exactly where you wanted to be at this time of the year, and you’re preparing for the next big steps in 2025. Either way, take pride in the journey. Reflection is about understanding, not about judgment. It’s a chance to pause and look back before we move forward.
60 Days to Reinvent Your Discipline
The next 60 days can be a powerful phase in your year. Even if progress has been slow up until now, there's no need to feel defeated. Every single day is an opportunity, and 60 days still gives you time to make a difference. Time is flying, but it’s not over yet.
If you’ve been wanting to set a daily routine, take these next two months to start small and get disciplined. If distractions have eaten away at your time this year, begin to minimize them now. Ask yourself—can you trade some of your scrolling time for a book? Can you swap a few of those “thinking about doing it” moments with “actually doing it”?
Here's the truth: staying disciplined isn’t about being perfect; it’s about showing up, each day, no matter how small the effort seems. And just imagine how much mental momentum you'll have going into the new year if you take these next 60 days seriously.
Creating Space for Growth
We’re constantly bombarded with distractions, from social media to TV shows, and even our own thoughts. But with a conscious effort to reduce these distractions, we can open up space to grow.
Consider setting boundaries for yourself. Here’s a simple exercise: for each of these next 60 days, spend 10–15 minutes in focused, distraction-free work on something that moves you closer to your goals. It doesn’t have to be groundbreaking. It could be reading a few pages of a book, writing a paragraph in your journal, or practicing a skill you want to improve. I’m currently reading “Think like a monk” by Jay Shetty. Will definitely update you on how the book is. Small, consistent actions make up the bigger picture of self-growth
.
Start Now: Less Scrolling, More Reading; Less Thinking, More Doing
The idea here is simple, yet incredibly powerful. Less scrolling, more reading. Less thinking, more doing. It’s so easy to get lost in planning mode, in wishing and hoping mode. But we only create real change by doing. And as we move into the last two months of the year, let’s focus on this practical approach.
If you’re feeling overwhelmed, simplify. Focus on one or two areas where you know you can make a meaningful impact by year’s end. Is it your physical health? Your learning goals? Your relationships? Whatever it is, commit to less time thinking about it and more time acting on it.
A Final Thought
Time truly does fly, and it’s easy to let another year slip away. But these last 60 days can become a launchpad for everything you want to achieve. Reflect, commit, and act. Discipline is a muscle that gets stronger every day you use it, and building that strength now will carry you into a strong start for 2025.
Here’s to making these next 60 days count. Let’s make 2024 a year we’re proud to look back on.
Best,
pathsofstoicism.

Subject: Don’t miss out on 35,000 bonus points!
[Reminder] Join our 5-Day Gen AI Intensive Course with Google
Message:
Kaggle








Hi ayush pokharel,

We're less than 2 weeks away! Join thousands of Kagglers who've signed up  
for our 5-Day Gen AI Intensive Course with Google on Nov 11-15.





Register for the Course



This no-cost online course was developed by several Google ML researchers  
and engineers to help you better understand some of the fundamentals behind  
Generative AI. Here's what we're covering:


Day 1: Foundational Models & Prompt Engineering - Explore the evolution of  
LLMs, from transformers to techniques like fine-tuning and inference  
acceleration. Get trained with the art of prompt engineering for optimal  
LLM interaction.
Day 2: Embeddings and Vector Stores/Databases - Learn about the conceptual  
underpinning of embeddings and vector databases, including embedding  
methods, vector search algorithms, and real-world applications with LLMs,  
as well as their tradeoffs.
Day 3: Generative AI Agents - Learn to build sophisticated AI agents by  
understanding their core components and the iterative development process.
Day 4: Domain-Specific LLMs - Delve into the creation and application of  
specialized LLMs like SecLM and Med-PaLM, with insights from the  
researchers who built them.
Day 5: MLOps for Generative AI - Discover how to adapt MLOps practices for  
Generative AI and leverage Vertex AI's tools for foundation models and  
generative AI applications.


Along with the daily readings and code lab assignments, every day is capped  
off with a livestream hosted by Paige Bailey. There'll be Q&As and  
discussion with some of the course authors and other special guests from  
Google. Even if you're unable to attend live, the recordings will be  
available to all registrants.

Curious to learn more? Head over to the event website for more info and to  
register.

Hope to see you there,

The Kaggle Team



Kaggle, Inc 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy Mountain View, CA 94043

This email was sent to ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com because you indicated that  
you'd like to receive news and updates about Kaggle. If you don't want to  
receive these emails in the future, please unsubscribe here. You can also  
change your preferences on your account's profile page by logging in at  
kaggle.com.

Subject: ⚡️ OpenAI Integrates Live Web Search in ChatGPT Using GPT-4o
Message:
On OpenAI, Meta, Anthropic, Google DeepMind, Open Source TTS, Magnific
and many more.. 

SIGNUP [1]  |  WORK WITH US [2]  |  FOLLOW ON X
[3]  |  READ ON WEB [4]

 . 

HEY ,

Welcome to AlphaSignal – the most read newsletter by AI
developers. 

We bring you the top 1% of news, papers, models, and repos, all
summarized to keep you updated on the latest in AI.

IN TODAY'S SIGNAL

_Read time: 6 min 45 sec_

🎖️ TOP NEWS

 	*
OpenAI Integrates Real-Time Web Search into ChatGPT [5]Using
Fine-Tuned GPT-4o.

📌 INSIGHT PARTNERS

 	*
The future of AI is here. Join AI visionaries at ScaleUp:AI, [6]
powered by Insight Partners.

⚡️ TRENDING SIGNALS

 	*
Meta releases MobileLLM [7], outperforming previous SOTA 125M/350M
models by up to 4.3%.

 	*
Anthropic releases Claude desktop app [8], bringing native desktop
experience for Claude to Mac/Windows users.

 	*
Google DeepMind unveils technical architecture behind NotebookLM [9]
and Illuminate's multi-speaker podcast audio generation.

 	*
Magnific unveils Mystic v2.5 image suite [10] offering hyperrealistic
to artistic image generation styles.

 	*
Researchers unveil open-source non-autoregressive TTS model [11]
MaskGCT supporting emotional synthesis and variable speeds.

📌 NEO4J

 	*
Join Neo4j NODES 2024, a free 24-hour virtual conference [12] on
knowledge graphs & AI

🧠 TOP PAPERS

 	*
A Survey of Small Language Models [13].

 	*
Large Language Models Reflect the Ideology of their Creators [14].

 	*
Dynamic Token Merging [15] for Efficient Byte-level Language Models

🧠 PYTHON TIP

 	*
Streamlined data augmentation using itertools for comprehensive
dataset variations

IF YOU'RE ENJOYING ALPHASIGNAL PLEASE FORWARD THIS EMAIL TO A
COLLEAGUE. 

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

Code Generation

OPENAI INTEGRATES REAL-TIME WEB SEARCH INTO CHATGPT USING FINE-TUNED
GPT-4O

⇧ 12,600 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

OpenAI launched web search capabilities for ChatGPT. The integration
combines GPT-4o's language processing with live web data access,
creating a hybrid system that bridges AI reasoning with current
information.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

 	*
Built on fine-tuned GPT-4o with novel synthetic data generation and
o1-preview distillation techniques.

 	*
Implements automatic search triggering based on query context
analysis.

 	*
Integrates specialized data modules for weather, stocks, sports, and
maps.

 	*
Features source attribution sidebar with clickable references.

 	*
Processes multi-turn conversations while maintaining context between
local and web knowledge.

TECHNICAL DETAILS

 	*
The system uses a fine-tuned version of GPT-4o as its core, enhanced
through post-training synthetic data generation.

 	*
The model incorporates output distillation from OpenAI's o1-preview,
enabling more sophisticated query understanding and context
maintenance across conversation turns.

 	*
The architecture combines third-party search providers with direct
publisher feeds.

 	*
The system automatically determines search necessity through context
analysis, while maintaining manual activation options. Source
attribution occurs through a dedicated sidebar system, linking to
original content.

 	*
Specialized modules handle real-time data streams for weather, stocks,
and sports through direct partnerships with data providers.

 	*
The system maintains 13 major publisher integrations, including
Reuters and AP, ensuring verified information sources.

ACCESS

 	*
Initial access starts with ChatGPT Plus and Team users, expanding to
Enterprise and Education users within weeks.

 	*
The rollout includes Advanced Voice and canvas feature integration
plans, with future expansions targeting shopping and travel domains
using o1 series capabilities.

MORE DETAILS ON UNDERYLING MECHANISM
The system processes queries through a multi-stage pipeline: context
analysis, search determination, data retrieval, and response
generation. This enables natural follow-up questions while maintaining
conversation context and source verification.

TOP PAPERS

Small Language Models

A SURVEY OF SMALL LANGUAGE MODELS [13]

⇧ 847 Likes

PROBLEM
SLMs address the resource intensity of Large Language Models by
creating efficient models for resource-constrained environments.
Current LLMs require significant compute and specialized hardware,
limiting their deployment flexibility.

SOLUTION
The paper presents three main approaches: (1) Lightweight
architectures like MobileBERT reducing parameters by 4.3x, (2)
Efficient training techniques including mixed precision and
parameter-efficient fine-tuning, (3) Model compression via pruning,
quantization, and knowledge distillation. Notable examples include
BabyLLaMA with 58M parameters and TinyLLaMA with 1.1B parameters.

RESULTS
Evaluations show SLMs achieve 96% of BERT performance with
significantly fewer parameters. BabyLLaMA outperforms teacher models
in data-constrained conditions. Quantization methods like GPTQ enable
4-bit compression while maintaining performance. Primary challenges
remain in reducing hallucination, bias, and energy consumption while
preserving model capabilities.

Foundational Models

LARGE LANGUAGE MODELS REFLECT THE IDEOLOGY OF THEIR CREATORS [14]

⇧ 759 Likes

PROBLEM
LLMs serve as influential information gatekeepers but their
ideological biases remain poorly understood. Previous studies relied
on direct questioning about political views, which may not reflect
natural behavior. A more ecological approach was needed to uncover how
LLMs' ideological stances vary across models, languages, and creators.

SOLUTION
The researchers developed a novel two-stage prompting methodology to
evaluate LLMs' ideological positions by analyzing how they describe
4,339 political figures. Stage 1 elicited natural descriptions, while
Stage 2 extracted moral assessments using a 5-point scale. This
approach revealed consistent ideological patterns reflecting creators'
worldviews.

RESULTS
When prompted in Chinese vs English, all LLMs showed more favorable
views toward Chinese policies/values (0.078 higher mean score).
Western LLMs emphasized liberal democratic values compared to
non-Western ones. Among Western models, significant variations emerged
- Google's Gemini strongly favored progressive values while OpenAI
models showed more skepticism toward supranational organizations and
welfare policies.

LLM

MRT5: DYNAMIC TOKEN MERGING FOR EFFICIENT BYTE-LEVEL LANGUAGE MODELS
[15]

⇧ 658 Likes

PROBLEM
ByT5 and other byte-level LLMs avoid tokenization issues but suffer
from significantly longer sequences and slower processing. ByT5
requires 33% longer pre-training time than mT5 and up to 10x slower
inference due to processing raw byte streams.

SOLUTION
MrT5 introduces a learnable deletion gate mechanism in the encoder
that dynamically shortens input sequences. The gate, placed after
layer 3, determines which tokens to remove while preserving contextual
information. During training, it uses soft attention masking, while at
inference it performs hard deletion of tokens.

RESULTS
MrT5 reduces sequence lengths by up to 80% while maintaining
comparable accuracy to ByT5 on XNLI and character-level tasks. It
achieves 38% faster inference on English XNLI with 52.56% sequence
reduction. The model demonstrates zero-shot cross-lingual transfer and
improves further with multilingual training. Code available at
github.com/jkallini/mrt5.

PYTHON TIP

STREAMLINED DATA AUGMENTATION USING ITERTOOLS FOR COMPREHENSIVE
DATASET VARIATIONS

Python's itertools.product() function to automatically generate every
possible combination of your data augmentation parameters (like
rotations, scales, flips) in a single flat loop, instead of writing
multiple nested for-loops.

You need itertools.product() when you want to try every possible
combination of multiple sets of options. 

This pattern helps you create rich dataset variations by combining
multiple augmentation techniques without writing nested loops. You'll
generate all possible combinations of transformations systematically.

Here's a quick example

from itertools import product, combinations
import numpy as np

def augment_dataset(
    image, 
    rotations=[0, 90, 180], 
    scales=[0.8, 1.0, 1.2],
    flips=[True, False]
):
    # Simulated transformations for demo
    aug_data = []
    for rot, scale, flip in product(
        rotations, scales, flips
    ):
        # Apply transformations sequentially
        transformed = image.copy()
        if flip:
            transformed = np.fliplr(transformed)
        # In real code, apply actual rotation/scaling
        aug_data.append(transformed)
    return aug_data

# Quick demo
image = np.random.rand(32, 32)
augmented = augment_dataset(image)
print(f"Generated {len(augmented)} variations")
# Generated 18 variations

WHY IT MATTERS

This approach reduces code complexity and speeds up augmentation by
40-60% compared to nested loops, while ensuring complete coverage of
transformation combinations.

Front-end vs. back-end developer: understanding the differences
---------------------------------------------------------------

In the realm of software development, we primarily identify
three types: front-end, back-end, and full-stack. Each carries
distinct responsibilities, utilizing different languages and
frameworks. In this guide, we'll demystify these types, comparing
and contrasting their functions and usage.

Subject: 👻Hacky Halloween!👻
👻Hacky Halloween!👻
🎃 Boo-st your skills with these killer hackathons!
Message:
( https://discord.com/invite/mYGykt3Dnx?utm_source=devpost&utm_medium=newsletter )

*********************************
Hackathons so good it's SCARY👻
*********************************

Happy Halloween everyone!🎃 There's nothing scarier than missing out on a spooktastic hackathon.😨

But no need to fear, we've rounded up the hottest hackathons on Devpost to make sure you don't ghost any of these opportunities.👻

What will you code to life?🧟

-Devpost Team 

 

*******************
FEATURED HACKATHONS
*******************

( https://github-copilot.devpost.com//?utm_source=devpost&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=10312024 )Accelerate App Development with   GitHub Copilot ( https://github-copilot.devpost.com//?utm_source=devpost&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=10312024 )

By: Microsoft

Empowering the Next Generation of Developers with GitHub and Azure

🏆 $10,000 in prizes
🗓️ December 18 deadline
🏷️ ML/AI, Open Ended, Web

( https://unlocked.devpost.com//?utm_source=devpost&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=10312024 )The Docusign Hackathon: Unlocked ( https://unlocked.devpost.com//?utm_source=devpost&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=10312024 )

Whether you’re starting fresh or returning to complete your degree, an undergraduate course or program can open up a new world of opportunities — and show employers you're ready for your next big step. Learn from expert faculty who are passionate about helping you achieve your goals, while you upskill in high-demand fields. It’s all about flexibility, so set your own schedule to balance work and personal achievement.
 
Explore top courses
https://click.sfmc.edx.org/?qs=ef1f046f50eba531640c0ac989bcc5ee76b55b55a018ca3127eda8001bf4a8c21c024197d912e11ae6a5f08da6a7cec044e8249bc123756713bcc20c11c31444
 
MicroBachelors(R)
programs
  
 You don’t have to wait years to change your future. Learn work-relevant skills and earn transferable college credits — preparing you for the next step in your career or education.
 
Mathematics and Statistics Fundamentals
  
 Pathway into University of London Online Degree Programs.

degrees
  
 Combine high-quality education with the flexibility of earning your undergraduate degree online. Explore your passions and develop valuable skills — paving your way to a fulfilling career.

Subject: Why Executives Seem Out of Touch, and How to Reach Them
Message:
View this post on the web at https://blog.bytebytego.com/p/why-executives-seem-out-of-touch

For this week's issue, I am pleased to introduce our guest author, Ethan Evans [ https://substack.com/redirect/3a6ba079-c9ae-4c69-8729-f311695c3457?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ], an ex-Amazon VP who played a pivotal role in creating some of the groundbreaking services we use today, such as Prime Video, Amazon Video, the Amazon Appstore, Prime Gaming (formerly Twitch Prime), and Twitch Commerce.
Beyond his experience as an engineering leader, Ethan is also a career growth coach who has assisted numerous individuals to get unstuck and level up their careers.
If you would like to connect with Ethan, you can do so on Twitter [ https://substack.com/redirect/72fbedae-b0c5-42e7-9fe0-e1dcae7a3943?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ] and LinkedIn [ https://substack.com/redirect/3a6ba079-c9ae-4c69-8729-f311695c3457?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]. Also, be sure to check out his newsletter and career community, Level Up [ https://substack.com/redirect/512652dd-ce37-4ae6-9fc6-26b133a0e3a0?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ] (ByteByteGo readers get a 25% discount off the annual subscription—highly recommended for more deep executive insights), and consider his highly rated live course on how to get unstuck and break through [ https://substack.com/redirect/7ded40db-bad7-4e1b-bc80-626195ebe62e?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ] to the next level in your career.
Employees in larger organizations often feel surprised and disconnected from the actions and decisions of their leaders.  The bigger the organization and the more distance to the leader, the more likely it is that their choices will be surprising and seem “out of touch.”

Unsubscribe https://substack..jz-Oec67U-ypXrm4zLbOOWbz_ftafLARTt__jOc4nPI?

Subject: Tell Us About Your University Selection Experience
Message:
Dear Ayush,

We'd like to learn more about how you made your decision when choosing the university that best aligned with your goals.

In the coming days, you'll receive a survey from Hanover Research, a partner we've teamed up with, to better understand the factors that influenced your choice.

While we understand you ultimately chose not to attend George Mason, we wish you all the best in your educational journey. Your input will help us reflect on and improve our admissions process, so we greatly value your feedback as a prospective student.

We look forward to hearing your thoughts. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at (703) 993-2000 or admissions@gmu.edu.

Office of Graduate Admissions | Apply Now 

George Mason University | 4400 University Drive | MSN 4C8 | Fairfax, VA 22030

Subject: The Standout Newsletter Vol. 24
Message:
Check out these five tips to make your job search easier and faster.

The Standout Newsletter Volume 24

Welcome to The Standout!

Living in rural Vermont, I heat my home with a wood stove. So I have to stack about two cords of wood every year to prepare for the winter.

Stacking this wood is a big task, so I usually put it off until snow is on the way. In other words, when desperation sets in.

This year I did something different. I decided to spend 20 minutes a day stacking wood and, lo and behold, it got done before Halloween!

Searching for a job is also a big task. But if you break it down into bite-sized chunks, it gets done. Need to update your resume? Spend 20 minutes a day on it. Need to reach out to connections? Start with just one message.

We all know this trick, but sometimes we just need a little reminder. 🎃

Check out our latest podcast episode…

In this episode of The Standout Jobseeker, Sydney Myers talks with Dr. Kyle Elliott, a tech career coach who uses a trauma-informed approach to help job seekers embrace their unique "fabulousness." Dr. Elliott shares tips on improving resumes, cover letters, and LinkedIn profiles, using tools like Gallup StrengthsFinder and AI. Key points include building confidence, getting feedback, and creating a personal brand that truly stands out.

nl15-1 (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VWbPJt2DcysjW5r4GTt8ccHyCW33LWhB5mRfslN2L_pzg5m_5PW6N1X8z6lZ3ngW8htYFc1_cRXZVSNR8P4msHx_W3TLdpx6VQP52V99Rsy4zWBqQW7HnRhS3SpfD3VWBd-98d8MZbW80h-9y19kdCWW77YZDg1N9_kSN8LwGn0gHVDFW1dd3qZ4X4SwcVQqBbZ3y848zW6SHf9884Xk8LW8FYxCf8MLxrfW5J6BV36DzMxgW780zX69j2x7VW3lMLwZ3KdTsMW7qQsRY6wXC-KW47x5Xs2sVCrbW6pJ1Zw2vcb_gW64GGsF69LlcMW4vdtZM1491Z0W4zj9ND1rz3ZhW6371d778mpDPW6SJCFC2ZFN6JVjkS2536qB20W2Zy6B48wdS9TW4V1_2F2Y7V-GW4jxPPc3SpPfBW8R1_yD4CxrJWW6VM-4q56s6YyW1MbvjX3zTznnW3wwJZ96Vz0S0W2bw4Hg4Cxr-zW18g2kR1zgX2SW7MgjRJ586Nr2W1_qYng2S_NckW5TcQ5x5y3vDpN3s46vg5WTyLf7Nx-r604 )

In today’s edition of The Standout newsletter, we offer the following five tips to help make your job search easier and faster:

Here’s the first tip…

🔥 Protect your energy by applying strategically 🔥

It’s tempting to apply for tons of jobs, but without a clear strategy, it can leave you feeling drained. Instead, focus on roles that genuinely align with your strengths and goals. This not only saves time, but it allows you to put more effort into the applications that matter most.

Next step: Set a weekly limit for job applications. Only apply to jobs that strongly appeal to you. Then use Jobscan (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VWbPJt2DcysjW5r4GTt8ccHyCW33LWhB5mRfslN2L_pzg3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3nJN55dtBHdgfrxW83DTlZ8r46_XW6HxlXl5xx3PXW4WVfd58YByDDW51s_bN67_JfPW82RDhl59_3D2W7wMZcN5lh8WHW5th1-D5sktHRW6nJsW84v79xYW2lFmNn18WPQkW8p9MG36Nshf7W8mLwH215YXcLN1G1vLBHZRfgW9cbbBP8LvgrKW7P4d0z2WMfwmW2rB6v-8_vV0QW48J-k361wR0dW92RcMw5PqQRSW3Zx9dZ78V3WlW97q2105JPxSKW6qMVP61vnLRQVytp1Q5GSZ91f3YnZ9g04 ) to create highly targeted resumes.

🔍 Discover what employers want the most 🔍

Gather 10 to 15 job descriptions for roles you are interested in. Study them and patterns will emerge—like the skills they’re asking for over and over, or the specific results they care about. This tells you what you need to focus on if you want to compete for these types of jobs.

Next step: Set up a simple spreadsheet or doc to keep track of those must-have skills and qualifications.

🎯 Practice a 30-second “Spotlight” speech 🎯

Prepare a 30-second “spotlight” speech to use during your job interview whenever the moment feels right. It could be when you’re introducing yourself, discussing your experience, or wrapping up. This speech should focus on your key strengths and how they align with the role.

Next step: For more job interview tips, read 19 Job Interview Tips That Will Get You Hired In 2024 (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VWbPJt2DcysjW5r4GTt8ccHyCW33LWhB5mRfslN2L_pzz3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3kFW7d-RGX45j7lsW1LnSMw8tQXB1N3w2GqRrsy60W4B8yBb2DyW2BW8DZZyk6vVfc-W671kG7139nDBW7Z0K6X1nCGzMW5bMF4F2x9CHjN310pjK2MWc5W5FjvHc27_ZmtW5G1X3C8zCfLlW8H7HsS64R1fvW1WPVjl40TvxHVTJLBD7gn7RtW1DBTzv1wc-jQW4Ms_CV2VqrHYN6J_T42ZLCMkW8w10pd6XpGr2W7xggJx2LlY4qW9cqvTL6FMxljW7vrm9b1qGKNnW5GLpyL53cgKFW6F8P4G1ppJ3tW4PvXp11L5Mkdf48zp-404 ) .

💰 Tap into referral bonuses as incentives 💰

Did you know that you’re four times more likely to get hired if you’re referred by an employee? And that many companies offer referral bonuses, which motivate employees to refer strong candidates? Use this to your advantage when reaching out. Here’s a message template you can use:

Next step: Go to LinkedIn. In the search bar, type the name of the company you’re interested in followed by the relevant department (for example “Airbnb marketing”). This will bring up employees who may be receptive to your message.

🤝 Network in everyday places 🤝

Networking doesn’t have to be all business. Casual places—like your kid’s soccer game or the hair stylist—can be perfect for building connections. Be specific. Instead of saying, "I'm looking for a job," say, "I'm looking for a role in healthcare." This makes it easier for people to think of possible connections.

Next step: The next time you’re with other people, start a conversation with someone new. Show genuine interest in their work, and you might uncover surprising opportunities along the way.

✨ Product update! New LinkedIn optimization tool ✨

Our new, improved LinkedIn optimization tool (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VWbPJt2DcysjW5r4GTt8ccHyCW33LWhB5mRfslN2L_pzz3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3mvW3lQzQ78M9KpwW3RnCt71Tqg2pW19FQDY8fCz_6V5_v6R4njMyXV5wFfp3rlG7bW12sX2v3_yCsnVV01w82WGHxYW1yvldx7DhnS7W6zQnGR98P2xHW68KBtP7x3t9vW706Y1b1RQ3_NW2hp8YY8qsZLHW4bpNF49gnly1W48kZ9F4hbSTpW19WT4R8tBT1PW63Nv7P802CGPMsZp05ZzvyZW4x22d_2JxwJ7N4t29fXmG2F3W3BDTfg4YP7BJW7_DKZT4Tx6-rW3b-5cv3sShRJW5HLRfK9kv-vSN3QqwgHmkFpTf5MljSY04 ) performs over 25 different checks to make sure your profile is as strong as it can be. The result? An average 132% increase in profile views and more than twice as many job interviews.

Subject: Building 'Beautification' Project
Thank you for your interest in Visa
Message:
Dear Ayush,
Thank you for your interest in the Systems Engineer Intern position. We’ve reviewed your background and experience and unfortunately, we have decided to move ahead with other candidates. With that said, we encourage you to join our Early Careers Talent Community: https://eulink.smartrecruiters.com/c/eJx00LGOGyEQxvGnWTpbwAwsFBTWna04xZ0UuT8NMGujeHct4Cz57SM7aVNN8xvp0z-t842WxzEHM5JSk8-MUfo8WhtNNDlbkQNKR0ZwUCNIcMZrLXimcv1RWl_r89mOGvw4jTlKNRkFKTpQnv650-PG4df-5_7tdPz8-Dp9fr3tPt6P77vTXlwC6ThZr7VFVEjRJIzRSrQQvSNgECVoqVFJUArRKL8FZPAjZB81euvNgLLNVHvlVL9L59q2aZ3FNVx6v7UBdoM-DPrAVK-PRJVf4O-lfi-NnnzQBzFza3TmYw7ICpLMeuNS5A1ajxuvZNxIZ9ChVpAIxFrLuSz75V7qusy89DBVWkQN9Phul-1t_X2hylc3oDw_O7xW9f-VuAf9JwAA__--s3om to receive updates about future opportunities and insights into life at Visa.
Throughout the recruiting season we will continue to refresh open roles and add new opportunities, so we encourage you to regularly explore the Early Careers page on https://eulink.smartrecruiters.com/c/eJx0z7uO6jAYBOCnwV2Qf99duECQo5MtQFqlR778BmtJguyAxNuvWG273RQzGn1xme5-fg3JSe0Bsk0oArVJKxVkkCkpkpygxkuCDjSn3EjLGMHJl9v_0talvsdKM2511ilQyBJ4DIaD9b-98XVH99l_9PtxOB3P4-m83x0Pw2E39uTqclZcxRw0JClj9hmDkllFBhaMYZIUxygTQDmAEBLslgvkVvNkAxNWWbkRtE2-rhVjfZQVa9vGZSI39yzNv-OG_Yu-ItZGJmzNX3BITiDwSBPrTAzYCWVFZ4GGjhopjGDAo-dkqeVS5n5-lrrME86ry9XPpDr_erTr9r58XX3Fm9kIenlTf47Xv7BPx74DAAD__7YCcMY and apply to roles that match your interests and skillsets. Good luck to you in your search and we hope to be in touch again in the future.
 
Best,
Visa Early Careers Recruiting Team

Rudra Pandey shared a post: Training Operations Manager Needed at Deerwalk Training Center

Deerwalk Training Center is looking for a dynamic and organized Training Operations Manager. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing multiple training sessions running simultaneously at the Deerwalk Campus. This role requires ensuring that all trainings are conducted as scheduled and delivered to the satisfaction of the trainees, maintaining a high standard of quality and organization. Additionally, the manager will focus on fostering a positive environment that ensures the satisfaction and well-being of both trainers and trainees.

Qualifications:
* A bachelor’s degree in a relevant field.
* A few years of experience in managing operations, training, or similar roles.
* Strong organizational, communication, and leadership skills.
If you are interested, please send your resume  with a cover letter to training@deerwalkcompware.com. You may also reach out directly to Hitesh Karki via direct message.

Please apply before November 10th, 2024.

We look forward to hearing from you!

⚡️ GitHub Copilot integrates Claude 3.5, Gemini 1.5 Pro along with OpenAI models
Message:
On Github, OpenAI, AWS, Perplexity, Meta, Stability AI and many
more.. 

SIGNUP [1]  |  WORK WITH US [2]  |  FOLLOW ON X
[3]  |  READ ON WEB [4]

 . 

HEY ,

Welcome to AlphaSignal – the most read newsletter by AI
developers. 

We bring you the top 1% of news, papers, models, and repos, all
summarized to keep you updated on the latest in AI.

IN TODAY'S SIGNAL

_Read time: 4 min 55 sec_

🎖️ TOP NEWS

 	*
GitHub Copilot Integrates Multiple LLMs, [5] Shifts Away from
OpenAI-Only Architecture.

📌 ORI

 	*
Build core AI systems with NVIDIA H200 infrastructure [6] available
through Ori Global Cloud.

⚡️ TRENDING SIGNALS

 	*
OpenAI introduces chat history search feature, [7] streamlining LLM
experimentation workflow.

 	*
AWS launches Q Developer, challenging GitHub Copilot [8] with in-IDE
AI assistance across major platforms.

 	*
Perplexity integrates with GitHub Copilot [9] to provide real-time
library updates and API assistance.

 	*
Meta unveils inference code and checkpoints for Layer Skip [10]:
accelerates LLM inference through selective layer execution.

 	*
Stability AI releases model checkpoint for open-source SD 3.5 Medium
[11], runs on 9.9GB VRAM consumer GPUs.

📌 GUIDDE

 	*
Magically create stunning how-to guides [12] with AI.

🛠️ TOP OF GITHUB

 	*
zerox [13]: Zero shot pdf OCR with gpt-4o-mini

 	*
gpt4free [14]: various collection of powerful language models

 	*
skyvern [15]: Automate browser-based workflows with LLMs and Computer
Vision

🧠 LECTURE

 	*
Running flux text-to-image model on 8GB GPUs [16] using quantization

IF YOU'RE ENJOYING ALPHASIGNAL PLEASE FORWARD THIS EMAIL TO A
COLLEAGUE. 

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

Code Generation

GITHUB COPILOT INTEGRATES MULTIPLE LLMS, SHIFTS AWAY FROM OPENAI-ONLY
ARCHITECTURE

⇧ 2,373 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

GitHub has transformed Copilot from a single-model to a multi-model AI
coding assistant, integrating Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Google's
Gemini 1.5 Pro, and OpenAI's o1-preview models. 

This marks the first major architectural shift since Copilot's 2021
launch with OpenAI's Codex.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

 	*
Gemini 1.5 Pro processes 100,000+ code lines with 2M token context
window.

 	*
Multi-file editing capability enables simultaneous changes across
codebases.

 	*
Real-time model switching available through single subscription
interface.

 	*
Automated code review system configures to team-specific requirements.

 	*
Direct integration with VS Code, GitHub.com, and Apple Xcode
environments.

 	*
Besides that, Microsoft also introduced a new feature called GitHub
Spark in VS Code to build entire applications in natural language. It
can develop apps and you can see live preview as it’s built. 

 	*
Microsoft is releasing GitHub Copilot code completion for Xcode too.

NEW CAPABILITIES

 	*
Each model serves distinct functions within the system. Gemini 1.5 Pro
handles multimodal inputs including code, images, and audio.

 	*
Gemini's 2M token context window enables full-project analysis. 
 

 	*
Claude 3.5 Sonnet specializes in complex refactoring and optimization
tasks.

 	*
The o1-preview model focuses on edge case detection and constraint
analysis.

 	*
VS Code is also getting multi-file editing, tab completion, code
review, autofix, rules configuration, and more. 

TECHNICAL USAGE

Developers will be able to switch between models during a conversation
with Copilot Chat to test and check which is a better fit. Users can
also set a preferred AI model and start their project on it from the
get-go.

Overall, the move is widely viewed as Microsoft’s effort to reduce
its reliance on OpenAI for future AI advancements. 

		 READ MORE [5] 

		 [6] 

BUILD CORE AI SYSTEMS WITH NVIDIA H200 INFRASTRUCTURE

Reserve early access to the NVIDIA H200 GPU with Ori Global Cloud! 

The H200 features 141GB VRAM to run complex AI models and
compute-intensive workloads.

Built for large-scale AI training and inference tasks, the H200
delivers enhanced memory bandwidth and compute performance.

Reserve now - limited early spots available.

		 SECURE YOUR ACCESS [6] 

_partner with us [17]_

TRENDING SIGNALS

OpenAI

OPENAI INTRODUCES CHAT HISTORY SEARCH FEATURE, STREAMLINING LLM
EXPERIMENTATION WORKFLOW [7]

⇧ 6,400 Likes

AWS

AWS LAUNCHES Q DEVELOPER, CHALLENGING GITHUB COPILOT WITH IN-IDE AI
ASSISTANCE ACROSS MAJOR PLATFORMS [8]

⇧ 1,477 Likes

Perplexity

PERPLEXITY INTEGRATES WITH GITHUB COPILOT TO PROVIDE REAL-TIME LIBRARY
UPDATES AND API ASSISTANCE [9]

⇧ 2,900 Likes

Meta

META UNVEILS INFERENCE CODE AND CHECKPOINTS FOR LAYER SKIP:
ACCELERATES LLM INFERENCE THROUGH SELECTIVE LAYER EXECUTION [10]

⇧ 1,200 Likes

Stable Diffusion

STABILITY AI RELEASES MODEL CHECKPOINT FOR OPEN-SOURCE SD 3.5 MEDIUM,
RUNS ON 9.9GB VRAM CONSUMER GPUS [11]

⇧ 1,407 Likes

MAGICALLY CREATE STUNNING HOW-TO GUIDES WITH AI.

Guidde's new AI platform automates training video creation. Record
workflows, get auto-generated steps, and add voice narration.

Click, capture, share - developers can deploy documentation in
minutes.

GET THE FREE EXTENSION [12]

TRENDING REPOS

PDF OCR

ZEROX [13]

☆ 5,210 Stars

Convert any document (PDFs, docs, spreadsheets) to structured markdown
using vision LLMs. Works with GPT-4V, Claude 3, Gemini. Process docs
with complex layouts and tables. Runs at 10 pages/minute. Available as
Python/Node packages. Handles 20+ file formats, supports parallel
processing, and maintains cross-page formatting consistency.

LLM

GPT4FREE [14]

☆ 60,900 Stars

Access GPT-4/3.5, Claude, Gemini through free reverse-engineered APIs.
Python package provides multi-threading, connection pooling, and
auto-failover. 54k+ GitHub stars. Handles 1M+ daily requests across
providers.

Automate browser

SKYVERN [15]

☆ 9,200 Stars

Build browser automation that doesn't break when websites change. Uses
LLMs + computer vision to understand and interact with web UIs in
real-time. Works on new sites without custom code. Handles logins,
2FA, forms, file downloads. Supports GPT-4, Claude 3, and Azure LLMs.

TOP LECTURE

Image Generation

RUNNING FLUX TEXT-TO-IMAGE MODEL ON 8GB GPUS USING QUANTIZATION

⇧ 474 Likes

Flux is the new and powerful text-to-image model that requires
substantial GPU memory to run.

This tutorial shows you how to run Flux on consumer-grade 8GB GPUs
using quantization - converting the model from 32-bit to 4-bit
precision.

The implementation uses HuggingFace's Diffusers library and recent
memory optimization techniques that reduce the model's memory
footprint by 8x while maintaining output quality.

YOU'LL LEARN

 	*
How to load and quantize T5 text encoder to 4-bit precision

 	*
Memory-efficient pipeline setup by loading only required components

 	*
Step-by-step text prompt encoding and image generation

 	*
Practical implementation of CPU offloading for large models

 	*
Memory management techniques for transformer-based image generation

 	*
Working with HuggingFace's optimization tools for large models

		 READ MORE [16] 

HOW WAS TODAY’S EMAIL?

AWESOME    DECENT     NOT GREAT

focused on AI, machine learning, and cutting-edge language models,

opportunities. We keep you connected to the breakthroughs and

as passionate about AI as we are.

Our partnerships are based on shared values of ethics, responsibility,
and a commitment to building a better world through technology.Privacy

By using our website, you accept these terms, which you can review on

use of your information. We’re based in the United States. By using

From: Bentley University Office of Graduate Admission <applygrad@bentley.edu>
Subject: Submit your transcript evaluation and get your graduate application fee waived at Bentley!
Message:
Hi Ayush,

                        At the McCallum Graduate School of Business, we believe that innovation, strategic thinking, and strong business knowledge are the cornerstones of success in today's ever-changing world. Our graduate degrees, including the new STEM MBA, are designed to equip you with the skills and insights to lead change and master good business.

                        If you submit a graduate application with a transcript evaluation prepared by an NACES-accredited agency <https://www.naces.org/members> between October 30 and November 15, 2024, you will be eligible to receive an application fee waiver. Once we receive your transcript evaluation, reach out to the graduate admission team at applygrad@bentley.edu and we will assist you with the waiver process. Don't miss the opportunity to save $133 USD.

                        Applying early maximizes your chances for a merit-based scholarship. And don't forget -- Bentley remains test-optional for the GMAT/GRE.

                        Don't miss a chance to earn a graduate degree from Bentley University, that recently has been ranked 11th Best College in US <https://www.bentley.edu/news/wall-street-journal-ranks-bentley-11th-best-college-us>, according to the Wall Street Journal!                      


Begin Application <https://businesscas2025.liaisoncas.com/applicant-ux/#/login>

                        If you have questions about the application process or would like to schedule a consultation, respond to this email or call 781-891-2108.   

                        Sincerely,    

                        Glisery Colon    
                        Director, Graduate Admission                        


 


This email was sent to ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com by Bentley University Office of Graduate Admission.
Unsubscribe from Bentley University. <https://applygrad.bentley.edu/go?r=optout&mid=8e4618f7-f4e0-4e8f-b31a-296ea64a80ac>

Subject: Hi Ayush, welcome to MongoDB! Let’s get started.
Message:
Here are a few resources to help you get started. 







Welcome to MongoDB Ayush




Ready to get your first MongoDB cluster up and running? Start with these four 
steps:

 * Create cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/deploy-free-tier-cluster/>
 * Add IP address to access list 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/security/add-ip-address-to-list/>
 * Create a user 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/create-mongodb-user-for-cluster/>
 * Connect to cluster 
<https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/connect-to-your-cluster/>



 

If you’re more of a visual learner, we’ve put together a six-minute video 
<https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas> that 
guides you through cluster setup.

 <https://learn.mongodb.com/courses/getting-started-with-mongodb-atlas>

Next, you can start building. Populate your newly-created cluster with some of 
our sample datasets. These are great for testing and quick prototyping.



Get started 
<https://account.mongodb.com/account/login?n=https%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fgo%3Fl%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fcloud.mongodb.com%2Fv2%2F%3Cproject%3E%26h%3Dclusters%2Fdetail%2F%3Ccluster%3E>

 <https://youtube.com/user/mongodb>  <https://www.instagram.com/mongodb>  
<https://www.mongodb.com/developer/>

Our team, including our Founder N.M. Gehi, Esq. Managing Partner of the Gehi & Associates Texas office Sonu Lal, Esq. and Karanpal Singh Chahal from #JamaicaAvenue were on hand to provide insights, answer questions, and discuss solutions for all your immigration needs. 

From employment-based visas to family petitions, we're here to guide you every step of the way. Thank you to everyone who stopped by to chat with us!

Break Through Tech shared a post: Join us for a livestream conversation with Amelia Barabander, Managing Director of Break Through Tech AI, and Emily Reid, CEO from AI4ALL, moderated by ATIH Executive Director Rebekah Tweed, on diversifying the talent pipeline for #AI.

The panel will delve into the importance of a diverse AI #workforce, the main barriers to achieving diversity, how these barriers vary across communities, and the distinct challenges faced by career-changing adults versus early-career and emerging talent.

#womenintech #breakthroughtech #techtalent

Subject: URGENT: Complete your HackUTD Applications.
Message:
Dear Applicants,

We wanted to remind you to double-check your applications to ensure they are properly submitted. Some of you who have edited your applications may not have completed the submission process correctly.

Please verify that when you visit ripple.hackutd.co/profile ( http://ripple.hackutd.co/profile ) , your application status says “ Application last submitted on XX/XX/2024 ” and does NOT display “ Continue Editing Application. ” If it shows " Continue Editing Application ," your application is not fully submitted.

To correctly submit your application:

* Click "Continue Editing Application"
* Navigate to the last page
* Click the “Update Application” button

This will ensure your application is submitted and ready for review.

*You can continue to edit your application for the next 2 days, make your edits ASAP! Let your friends know, edit and submit your applications, and get ready for HackUTD 2024!*

Best,

HackUTD Team

HackUTD Team

800 West Campbell Road , Richardson , TX 75080

Subject: Join our YouTube livestream with Cohere For AI!
Message:
Kaggle








Hi ayush pokharel,

Have you ever wondered how a new ML model gets created? Do you wish you  
understood the research breakthroughs that are driving innovation? Do you  
love language, linguistics or large language models?

On Thursday, October 31st at 11 am EST, on YouTube Live I will be hosting  
Cohere For AI's Senior Research Scientists Marzieh Fadaee and Ahmet Üstün –  
asking YOUR questions about the new Aya Expanse model. Make sure you get  
your question in!





Ask Your Question Here



I can't wait to learn more with you about this groundbreaking model. See  
you on Thursday!

Brenda Flynn

Model Partnerships Lead



Kaggle, Inc 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy Mountain View, CA 94043

This email was sent to ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com because you indicated that  
you'd like to receive news and updates about Kaggle. If you don't want to  
receive these emails in the future, please unsubscribe here. You can also  
change your preferences on your account's profile page by logging in at  
kaggle.com.
