Subject: 1.8 Trillion Events Per Day with Kafka: How Agoda Handles it
Message:
View this post on the web at https://blog.bytebytego.com/p/18-trillion-events-per-day-with-kafka

Cut Code Review Time & Bugs into Half with CodeRabbit (Sponsored) [ https://substack.com/redirect/692a5a19-0155-4c05-8301-1edaa08fe82f?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]
CodeRabbit is an AI Code Reviewer that helps you or your team merge your code changes faster with superior code quality. CodeRabbit doesn’t just point out issues; it suggests fixes and explains the reasoning behind the suggestions. Elevate code quality with AI-powered, context-aware reviews and 1-click fixes.
CodeRabbit provides:
• Automatic PR summaries and file-change walkthroughs.
• Runs popular linters like Biome, Ruff, PHPStan, etc.
• Highlights code and configuration security issues.
• Enables you to write custom code review instructions and AST grep rules.
To date, CodeRabbit has reviewed more than 5 million PRs, is installed on a million repositories, has 15k+ daily developer interactions, and is used by 1000+ organizations.
PS: CodeRabbit is free for open-source.
Disclaimer: The details in this post have been derived from the Agoda Engineering Blog. All credit for the technical details goes to the Agoda engineering team. The links to the original articles are present in the references section at the end of the post. We’ve attempted to analyze the details and provide our input about them. If you find any inaccuracies or omissions, please leave a comment, and we will do our best to fix them.
Agoda sends around 1.8 trillion events per day through Apache Kafka.
Since 2015, the Kafka usage at Agoda has grown tremendously with a 2x growth YOY on average.
Kafka supports multiple use cases at Agoda, which are as follows:
Analytical data management
Feeding data into the data lake
Near real-time monitoring and alerting solutions
Building asynchronous APIs
Data replication across data centers
Serving data to and from Machine Learning pipelines
As the scale and Kafka usage grew, multiple challenges forced Agoda’s engineering team to develop solutions.
In this post, we’ll examine some key challenges that Agoda faced and the solutions they implemented.
Simplifying how Developers Send Data to Kafka
One of the first changes Agoda made was around sending data to Kafka.
Agoda built a 2-step logging architecture:
A client library writes events to disk. It handles file rotations and manages the write file locations.
A separate daemon process (Forwarder) reads the events and forwards them to Kafka. It is responsible for reading the files, sending the events to Kafka, tracking file offsets, and managing the deletion of completed files.
See the diagram below:
The architecture separates operational concerns away from development teams, allowing the Kafka team to perform tasks like dynamic configuration, optimizations, and upgrades independently. The client library has a simplified API for producers, enforces serialization standards, and adds a layer of resiliency.
The tradeoff is increased latency for better resiliency and flexibility, with a 99-percentile latency of 10s for analytics workloads. For critical and time-sensitive use cases requiring sub-second latency, applications can bypass the 2-step logging architecture and write to Kafka directly.
Splitting Kafka Clusters Based On Use Cases
Agoda made a strategic decision early on to split their Kafka clusters based on use cases instead of having a single large Kafka cluster per data center. 
This means that instead of having one massive Kafka cluster serving all kinds of workloads, they have multiple smaller Kafka clusters, each dedicated to a specific use case or set of use cases.
The main reasons for this approach are:
By having separate clusters for different use cases, any issues that arise in one cluster will be contained within that cluster and won’t affect the others.
Different use cases may have different requirements in terms of performance, reliability, and data retention.
For example, a cluster used for real-time data processing might be configured with lower data retention periods and higher network throughput to handle the high volume of data.
In addition to splitting Kafka clusters by use case, Agoda also provisions dedicated physical nodes for Zookeeper, separate from the Kafka broker nodes. Zookeeper is a critical component in a Kafka cluster, responsible for managing the cluster's metadata, coordinating broker leader elections, and maintaining configuration information.
Stop renting auth. Make it yours instead.(Sponsored) [ https://substack.com/redirect/5852393b-261b-4e1d-aaff-ada5c347874f?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]
Developer-Centric: True API first design, quick integration, built on standards, highly flexible & customizable.
Hosting Flexibility: You host or we host - the choice is yours with no loss of features.
Unlimited: Unlimited IDPs, unlimited users, unlimited tenants, unlimited applications, always free.
Total Control: Deploy on any computer, anywhere in the world and integrate easily with any tech stack.
Scale Confidently: Lightning-fast performance for 10 users or 10 million users (or more).
Data Isolation: Single tenant by design means your data is physically isolated from everyone else’s.
FusionAuth is a complete auth & user platform that has 15M+ downloads and is trusted by industry leaders.
Monitoring and Auditing Kafka
From a monitoring point of view, Agoda uses JMXTrans to collect Kafka broker metrics. 
JMXTrans is a tool that connects to JMX (Java Management Extensions) endpoints and collects metrics. These metrics are then sent to Graphite, a time-series database that stores numeric time-series data.
The collected metrics include things like broker throughput, partition counts, consumer lag, and various other Kafka-specific performance indicators. 
The metrics stored in Graphite are visualized using Grafana, a popular open-source platform for monitoring and observability. Grafana allows the creation of customizable dashboards that display real-time and historical data from Graphite.
For auditing, Agoda implemented a custom Kafka auditing system. The primary goal of this auditing system is to ensure data completeness, reliability, accuracy, and timeliness across the entire Kafka pipeline.
Here’s how it works:
Audit counts are generated at various points throughout the pipeline. 
A separate thread runs in the background on Agoda’s client libraries as part of the 2-step logging architecture we discussed earlier. This thread asynchronously aggregates message counts across time buckets to generate audits.
The generated audit data is stored in a separate Kafka cluster dedicated to audit information. This ensures the audit data doesn’t interfere with the main data pipelines.
The audit information ultimately ends up in two places:
Whitefalcon: Agoda’s internal near real-time analytics platform
Hadoop: For longer-term storage and analysis.
Authentication and ACLs
Initially, Agoda’s Kafka clusters were used primarily for application telemetry data, and authentication wasn’t deemed necessary.
As Kafka usage grew exponentially, concerns arose about the inability to identify and manage users who might be abusing or negatively impacting Kafka cluster performance. Agoda completed and released its Kafka Authentication and Authorization system in 2021.
The Authentication and Authorization system consists of the following components:
Core Kafka Authentication:  It likely uses SASL (Simple Authentication and Security Layer) mechanisms supported by Kafka.
ACLs: Access Control Lists for fine-grained permission management.
Credential Generation: A custom component for creating and managing user credentials.
Credential Assignment: A system to associate credentials with specific users or teams.
Self-Service Portal: An interface allowing teams to request Kafka credentials and ACLs without direct intervention from the Kafka team.
Kafka Load Balancing
Agoda, as an online travel booking platform, aims to offer its customers the most competitive and current prices for accommodations and services from a wide range of external suppliers, including hotels, restaurants, and transportation providers. 
To achieve this, Agoda's supply system is designed to efficiently process and incorporate a vast number of real-time price updates received from these suppliers. A single supplier can provide 1.5 million price updates and offer details in just one minute. Any delays or failures in reflecting these updates can lead to incorrect pricing and booking failures.
Agoda uses Kafka to handle these incoming price updates. Kafka partitions help them achieve parallelism by distributing the workload across mple partitions and consumers.
See the diagram below:
The Partitioner and Assignor Strategy
Apache Kafka's message distribution and consumption are heavily influenced by two key strategies: the partitioner and the assignor.
The partitioner strategy determines how incoming messages are allocated across partitions during production. Common approaches include round-robin distribution and sticky partitioning. 
On the consumer side, the assignor strategy dictates how partitions are distributed among consumers within a consumer group. Examples include range assignments and round-robin assignments.
See the diagram below for reference:
Traditionally, these strategies were designed with the assumption that all consumers have similar processing capabilities and that all messages require roughly the same amount of processing time. 
However, Agoda's real-world scenario deviated from these assumptions, leading to significant load-balancing challenges in their Kafka implementation.
There were two primary challenges:
Hardware Heterogeneity: Agoda's use of a private cloud infrastructure with Kubernetes resulted in pods being deployed across servers with varying hardware specifications. Benchmark tests revealed substantial performance disparities between different hardware generations.
Inconsistent Message Workloads: The processing requirements for different messages varied considerably. Some messages necessitated additional steps such as third-party API calls or database queries, leading to unpredictable processing times and latency fluctuations.
These challenges ultimately resulted in an over-provisioning problem, where resources were inefficiently allocated to compensate for the load imbalances caused by hardware differences and varying message processing demands.
Overprovisioning Problem at Agoda
The over-provisioning involves allocating more resources than necessary to handle the expected peak workload efficiently.
To illustrate this, let's consider a scenario where Agoda's processor service employs Kafka consumers running on heterogeneous hardware:
They have two high-performance workers, each capable of processing 20 messages per second.
Additionally, they have one slower worker that can only handle 10 messages per second.
Theoretically, this setup should be able to process a total of 50 messages per second (20 + 20 + 10). However, when using a round-robin distribution strategy, each worker receives an equal share of the messages, regardless of their processing capabilities. If the incoming message rate consistently reaches 50 messages per second, the following issues arise:
The two faster workers can comfortably handle their allocated share of approximately 16.7 messages per second each.
The slower worker, on the other hand, struggles to keep up with its assigned 16.7 messages per second, resulting in a growing lag over time.
See the diagram below
To maintain acceptable latency and meet processing SLAs, Agoda would need to allocate additional resources to this setup. 
In this example, they would have to scale out to five machines to effectively process 50 messages per second. This means that they are overprovisioning by two extra machines due to the inefficient distribution logic that fails to consider the varying processing capabilities of the hardware.
A similar scenario can occur when the processing workload for each message varies, even if the hardware is homogeneous. 
In both cases, this leads to several negative consequences:
Higher hardware costs due to the need for additional resources.
Inefficient utilization of resources, with some consumers being underutilized while others are overburdened.
Increased maintenance overhead to manage the overprovisioned infrastructure.
The round-robin distribution strategy, while ensuring an equal distribution of messages across consumers, fails to account for the heterogeneity in hardware performance and message processing workload.
Agoda’s Dynamic Lag-Aware Solution
To solve this, Agoda adopted a dynamic, lag-aware approach to solving the Kafka load balancing challenges. They didn’t opt for static balancing solutions like weighted load balancing due to messages having non-uniform workloads.
They implemented two main strategies:
Lag-aware Producer
Lag-aware Consumer
Lag-Aware Producer
A lag-aware producer is a dynamic approach to load balancing in Apache Kafka that adjusts message partitioning based on the current lag information of the target topic. 
It works as follows:
The producer maintains a cached copy of partition lag data to minimize the frequency of requests to Kafka brokers for this information.
The producer uses the lag data to intelligently distribute messages across partitions using a custom algorithm. The algorithm is designed to send fewer messages to partitions with high lag and more messages to partitions with low lag. They use algorithms like the same-queue length algorithm and outlier detection algorithm.
When the lags across partitions are balanced and stable, the lag-aware producer ensures an even distribution of messages.
Let's consider an example scenario in Agoda's supply system, where an internal producer publishes task messages to a processor. 
The target topic has 6 partitions with the following lag distribution:
Partition 1: 110 messages
Partition 2: 150 messages
Partition 3: 80 messages
Partition 4: 400 messages
Partition 5: 120 messages
Partition 6: 380 messages
In this situation, the lag-aware producer would identify that partitions 4 and 6 have significantly higher lag compared to the other partitions. As a result, it would adapt its partitioning strategy to send fewer messages to partitions 4 and 6 while directing more messages to the partitions with lower lag (partitions 1, 2, 3, and 5).
By dynamically adjusting the message distribution based on the current lag state, the lag-aware producer helps to rebalance the workload across partitions, preventing further lag accumulation on the already overloaded partitions. 
Lag-Aware Consumer
Lag-aware consumers are a solution employed when multiple consumer groups are subscribed to the same Kafka topic, making lag-aware producers less effective.
The process works as follows:
In a downstream service, such as Agoda's Processor, if a particular consumer instance detects that it has fallen significantly behind in processing messages (i.e., it has a high lag), it can voluntarily unsubscribe from the topic. This action triggers a rebalance operation.
During the rebalance, a custom partition Assigner, developed by Agoda, reassigns the partitions across all the remaining consumer instances. The redistribution takes into account each consumer's current lag and processing capacity, ensuring a more balanced workload.
To minimize the performance impact of rebalancing, Agoda leverages Kafka 2.4's incremental cooperative rebalance protocol. This protocol allows for more frequent partition reassignments without causing significant disruptions to the overall processing flow.
Let's illustrate this with an example.
Suppose Agoda's Processor service has three consumer instances (workers) that are consuming messages from six partitions of a topic:
Worker 1 is responsible for processing messages from Partitions 1 and 2
Worker 2 handles Partitions 3 and 4
Worker 3 processes messages from Partitions 5 and 6
If Worker 3 happens to be running on older, slower hardware compared to the other workers, it may struggle to keep up with the message influx in Partitions 5 and 6, resulting in higher lag. In this situation, Worker 3 can proactively unsubscribe from the topic, triggering a rebalance event.
During the rebalance, the custom Assigner evaluates the current lag and processing capacity of each worker and redistributes the partitions accordingly. For example, it may assign Partition 5 to Worker 1 and Partition 6 to Worker 2, effectively relieving Worker 3 of its workload until the lag is reduced to an acceptable level.
Conclusion
In conclusion, Agoda's journey with Apache Kafka has been one of continuous growth, learning, and adaptation. 
By implementing strategies such as the 2-step logging architecture, splitting Kafka clusters based on use cases, developing robust monitoring and auditing systems, and Kafka load balancing Agoda has successfully managed the challenges that come with handling 1.8 trillion events per day. 
As Agoda continues to evolve and grow, its Kafka setup will undoubtedly play a crucial role in supporting the company's ever-expanding needs. The various solutions also provide great learning for other software developers in the wider community when it comes to adapting Kafka to their organizational needs.
References:
How Agoda manages 1.8 trillion events per day on Kafka [ https://substack.com/redirect/7b8ce2d7-1cea-42da-b1a7-6f4dbd817830?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]
How we solve load balancing challenges in Apache Kafka [ https://substack.com/redirect/653facf7-9723-479c-94d7-d51b6e2c3cf6?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]
Kafka SASL [ https://substack.com/redirect/184c0245-af52-4b4b-a823-07cb65e8d603?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]

Texas State University Center for Analytics and Data Science (TXST CADS) shared a post: ✨ What an insightful session! ✨

We thoroughly enjoyed Friday's Analytics Seminar Series event, featuring Dr. Jelena Tešić. Her talk on "Data-driven Considerations in Innovative Predictive Modeling from Noisy Tabular Data in Education and Healthcare" was packed with valuable insights.

A big thank you to Dr. Jelena Tešić for her expertise and to everyone who joined us, both in person and on Zoom!

Stay tuned for more exciting events from the Department of Information Systems and Analytics and the Texas State Center for Analytics and Data Science (TXST CADS). 🚀

#TXSTCADS #ExpandAI #Analytics #DataScience #AI #Healthcare #Education #TXST #Innovation #PredictiveModeling

Subject: Thank you for Applying to Amazon!
Message:
Hi Ayush,

Thanks for applying to Amazon! We've received your application for the Quality Assurance Engineer Summer Internship – 2025 (US) (ID: 2736987) position.

What happens next?

If we decide to move forward with your application, the Amazon recruiting team will reach out to discuss next steps. Any updates to your application status will be reflected on your Application dashboard, so be sure to check back regularly.

Go to your application dashboard

Explore our interview resources for more information on the hiring process and how to prepare for interviews. To learn more about our peculiar culture, visit Amazon.jobs, and get the latest Amazon news and stories by following our Day One blog.

Best regards,
Amazon Recruiting Team

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data are longstanding top priorities for Amazon. If you are an external candidate, please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer the personal data of our candidates. You can let us know if you do not want to be contacted for recruitment purposes. Please refer to the "What are my rights under applicable data protection laws?" section of the Notice for more information. If you are an internal candidate, please consult the Employee Privacy Notice.

Please don't reply to this email, as we can't review or respond to messages at this address.

Subject: Welcome to Overleaf
Message:
Hi,

Thanks for signing up to Overleaf! If you ever get lost, you can log in again (https://www.overleaf.com/login) with the email address 'ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com'.

If you're new to LaTeX, take a look at our Help Guides (https://www.overleaf.com/learn) and Templates (https://www.overleaf.com/templates).

PS. We love talking to our users about Overleaf. Reply to this email to get in touch with us directly, whatever the reason. Questions, comments, problems, suggestions, all welcome!

Regards,
The Overleaf Team - https://www.overleaf.com

Message:

Thank you for your interest in Quality Assurance Engineer Summer Internship – 2025 (US) (ID: 2736987).

Don't worry! You can complete it here when you're ready.

­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ 

( https://www.notion.so?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Introducing layouts, forms, mail, marketplace and automations ( https://www.notion.so?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Hi Ayush,

I think this may be our largest release ever?!

We’ve just shipped forms, automations, layouts, a new Marketplace, custom emojis, and a sneak peek of Notion Mail! The team has worked really hard to bring you these features, and we hope they make it faster and easier than ever to get things done—all in one tool.

Try new features ( https://www.notion.so/?mwn2024=true&utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Notion Mail (coming soon!)

Email hasn’t changed in 20 years. It's cluttered, chaotic, and hard to manage. So we rebuilt it! Notion Mail is fast, minimal, and does all the organizing and back-and-forth of scheduling for you! Best part is “views” that let you customize your inbox to your workflows, just like the rest of Notion. We can’t wait for you to try the preview and hear how it changes the way you work. Join the waitlist! ( https://www.notion.so/product/mail?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Notion Mail preview ( https://www.notion.so/?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Introducing forms, right inside Notion!

Forms give you an easy way to capture the info you need—from your personal trackers to RSVPs, surveys, and signup forms you can share with others! Responses are stored in a Notion database, where you can keep everything organized and visualize data in a chart. No need for an outside tool! The best part is you get unlimited forms for
free. Try one out → ( https://notion.so/?target=create_form&utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Forms within Notion ( https://notion.so/?target=create_form&utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Layouts to customize your page

Your work is unique and your tools should be flexible enough to match! So we created a way for you to further customize your goals, documents, or whatever you keep in Notion. Layouts bring more beauty and creativity to pages! Try it out by hovering over any database page title and clicking Customize layout.

Layouts to customize your page ( https://www.notion.so/?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Introducing the new Marketplace

Have you created an amazing setup or workflow? We’ve made it easier than ever to list and sell your template. Native payments, analytics, reviews and ratings, safeguards to prevent unfair re-distribution—all in the best place for millions of users to discover your work! Whether you’re looking for the perfect template or starting a business—there are creators who make seven figures on Notion!—this is the place. Go to Marketplace → ( https://www.notion.so/templates?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Notion marketplace ( https://www.notion.so/templates?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Custom emojis!

Maybe the best update ever? You can now upload your own emojis! Use them in your page titles or anywhere—just type /emoji or : followed by its name. Our favorite is :bufo-thumbs-up: :bufo-thumbsup: .

Custom emojis ( https://www.notion.so/?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Personalize your URLs

Notion Site URLs often have a long string of numbers and characters, but now you can make them exactly what you’d like! Cory, our video producer and resident birder, turned his site birdingnyc.com/My-spotted-birds-1c7d9d506ecf4802b686839e8ddc9909 into birdingnyc.com/mybirds. Just use the Share → Publish menu. This will be rolling out to everyone in the coming weeks. If you don't see it yet, you will soon. Learn more → ( https://www.notion.so/help/manage-your-notion-sites?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Personalize URLs ( https://www.notion.so/?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Automate more actions with formulas

This is a true superpower. Database and button automations now support formulas that can complete steps in the background when you trigger an action—a huge timesaver. For example, when you mark a task done, you can automatically show how little time it took to complete. Dig in to learn more → ( https://www.notion.so/help/database-automations?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io#database-automation-actions )

Automations now support formulas ( https://www.notion.so/?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Automations can now send emails

Now you can use an automation to notify people via Gmail (one of your top requests!). Trigger an email when information changes, like when a form has been submitted or the status of a task changes. Soon you’ll be able to send custom web requests to platforms like Zapier and Make to trigger actions in other apps, too.

Automations to notify people via email ( https://www.notion.so/?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

Shortcut to Notion features

When searching, type in a keyword like “Home,” “Settings,” or “Templates” to jump to specific places in Notion. Try it with the ⌘ P keyboard shortcut. It’s a small thing that can make you much
faster!

Notion mail ( https://notion.so/?target=quickfind&utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

A few more improvements

•
Load database info 15% faster. Even with all these new features, performance is still our top priority.

•
Now your page titles, database views, and database pages are aligned (check it out ( https://x.com/NotionHQ/status/1846230579630481896?utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )). Sometimes the smallest design details matter most!

Try new features ( https://www.notion.so/?mwn2024=true&utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

We hope these new releases help make Notion the only tool you need to do your life’s work. But please keep the feedback coming. We are always looking for ways to improve your experience!

More soon,

Ivan

P.S. We debuted these releases and more at our first-ever our conference, Make with Notion. You can watch live demos and hear customer stories here ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UhHaVSd3h6U&utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io ). I hope you like what you see!

Ivan Zhao at Make with Notion ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UhHaVSd3h6U&utm_campaign=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=What%27s+New+2.46+-+Make+with+Notion+-+Personal+-+EN&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io )

In one AI-powered workspace.

TOP NEWS

Image Generation Model

STABILITY AI LAUNCHES STABLE DIFFUSION 3.5: AN 8B PARAMETER
OPEN-SOURCE IMAGE GENERATION MODEL.

⇧ 2,373 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

Stability AI released Stable Diffusion 3.5, marking a significant
architectural advancement in open-source image generation. This
release addresses the limitations of June's SD3 Medium version through
fundamental changes in transformer block design and training
methodology. 

The new update introduces three model variants, each designed to cater
to different user needs.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS:

 	*
Large variant (8B parameters) operates at 1 megapixel resolution with
superior prompt adherence.

 	*
Large Turbo, is a distilled version of Stable Diffusion 3.5 Large and
achieves comparable quality.

 	*
Medium variant (2.5B parameters) supports 0.25 to 2 megapixel range.

 	*
Query-Key Normalization enables enhanced fine-tuning capabilities.

 	*
Free commercial use for sub-$1M revenue entities.

ARCHITECTURE

 	*
The core technical innovation centers on Query-Key Normalization in
transformer blocks, which stabilizes the training process and
simplifies downstream fine-tuning.

 	*
This architecture produces higher output variation with identical
prompts and seeds, maintaining a broader knowledge base and style
diversity.

 	*
The trade-off enables more flexible customization but requires more
specific prompting for consistent results.

PERFORMANCE METRICS

 	*
Performance metrics show the Large variant leading in prompt adherence
benchmarks against comparable models.

 	*
The Large Turbo variant achieves inference speeds significantly faster
than non-distilled models while maintaining competitive quality
metrics.

DEPLOYMENT

 	*
Deployment options include self-hosting through Hugging Face, direct
API access, or integration with platforms like Replicate and ComfyUI.

 	*
The architecture supports batch processing and multi-resolution
generation, with specific optimizations in the Medium variant for
resolution flexibility.

 	*
The Medium variant's MMDiT-X architecture incorporates specialized
training methods for improved coherence across different resolutions.

 	*
Hardware requirements vary by model size: Large variants need
enterprise-grade GPUs, while Medium runs on consumer hardware with
standard VRAM configurations.

Implementation tooling includes standard fine-tuning pipelines, with
enhanced stability from the Query-Key Normalization allowing for more
aggressive learning rates during customization.

SLOW MODELS? GET OPTIMIZED PERFORMANCE + DISTRIBUTED INFRASTRUCTURE
WITH BASETEN

Descript, Bland AI, and Rime engineers achieve millisecond-level model
inference latency with Baseten's infrastructure.

The platform just released performance updates for open-source,
fine-tuned, and custom models.

Alpha Signal readers receive $30 in credits.

DEPLOY YOUR FIRST MODEL [12]

TOP TUTORIALS

AI Agent

BUILD A LANGGRAPH AGENT WITH GRAPH MEMORY [13]

⇧ 382 Likes

Learn to build intelligent agents with LangGraph and Graphiti for
persistent conversational memory. This tutorial shows how to create a
product recommendation system using graph databases. You'll implement
conversation history tracking, custom search tools, and state
management in Neo4j. The system maintains context across user
interactions through graph-based memory while serving personalized
product suggestions from a database.

Llama-index

 BUILD AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM THAT TURNS ARXIV PAPERS INTO STRUCTURED
REPORTS [14]

⇧ 102 Likes

Learn to build an automated research paper report generator using
LlamaIndex and OpenAI. This hands-on tutorial shows you how to fetch
arXiv papers, extract metadata using Pydantic, and create structured
reports through RAG workflows. You'll implement a complete system that
downloads papers, parses PDFs, generates intelligent queries, and
produces formatted research summaries using LLM agents.

GPU

LEARN TO CALCULATE EXACT GPU MEMORY REQUIREMENTS FOR DEPLOYING LLMS IN
PRODUCTION SYSTEMS [15]

⇧ 1,400 Likes

Learn how to calculate exact GPU memory needed for serving LLMs in
production. This guide gives you the core formula. You'll understand
parameter count impact, precision choices (16-bit vs 32-bit), and
memory overhead calculations. Know exactly how many GPUs you need for
models like LLaMA-70B, avoiding deployment bottlenecks.

DEEP DIVE

Speech-to-speech

DEPLOY SPEECH-TO-SPEECH MODELS ON HUGGINGFACE FOR PRODUCTION USE

⇧ 893 Likes

Speech-to-Speech (S2S) on Hugging Face is a pipeline that combines
Voice Activity Detection, Speech-to-Text, Language Model, and
Text-to-Speech components for real-time voice interactions. 

The system supports English, French, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and
Korean, with automatic language detection capabilities.

IN THIS GUIDE, YOU'LL LEARN

 	*
Building custom Docker images for S2S deployment

 	*
Setting up Hugging Face Inference Endpoints with GPU acceleration

 	*
Implementing websocket-based client-server architecture for low
latency

 	*
Managing model dependencies and data preprocessing

 	*
Configuring container settings for optimal performance

 	*
Handling audio streaming and playback

 	*
Integrating with the Hugging Face hub

IMPLEMENTATION STEPS

 	*
Clone the Hugging Face inference toolkit

 	*
Add S2S codebase as submodules

 	*
Modify Dockerfile for dependency management

 	*
Build and push custom Docker image

 	*
Configure Inference Endpoint with L4 GPU

 	*
Set up websocket handlers for audio streaming

 	*
Implement audio recording and playback client

HackUTD 2024 Travel Assistance Update
Message:
Hello,

Thank you for your interest in HackUTD and applying for travel assistance to attend the event. However, we regret to inform you that we are unable to provide travel assistance for your participation in HackUTD this year. This year we had over 300 applications with a total requested amount of over $80,000, making this a very challenging decision for our team.

We still hope you’ll be able to join us at HackUTD! You’re welcome to apply through the regular application process on our website at ripple.hackutd.co ( http://ripple.hackutd.co ) , and please note that your application will be given priority consideration. If you have any questions or need further information, feel free to reach out to our team at hello@hackutd.co ( hello@hackutd.co?subject=&body= ).

Thank you once again for your understanding.

Best,
HackUTD Team

HackUTD Team

800 West Campbell Road , Richardson , TX 75080

Subject: [Reminder] Build End to End Python Pipelines in Snowflake is Starting in 48hrs
Message:
Thanks for registering for our upcoming hands-on lab Build End to End Python Pipelines in Snowflake Date – October 30, 2024 Time – 10:00 AM PT Duration – 1 hour

Complete the following steps before the event:

  1. Access your hands-on lab guide here and complete Step 1 prerequisites.
  2. Sign up for a Snowflake free trial (we recommend Enterprise).
  3. Activate your free trial account: you will receive an email to activate your account. If you don’t see your activation email in your inbox, please check your spam folder.

Be sure to add the event to your calendar. <[[]]>Download ICS <[[https://www.snowflake.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Build-End-to-End-Python-Pipelines-in-Snowflake.ics]]> | Add to Google Calendar™ <[[https://calendar.google.com/calendar/r/eventedit?action=TEMPLATE&text=Build+End+to+End+Python+Pipelines+in+Snowflake&dates=20241030T100000/20241030T110000&details=Use+the+link+below+to+enter+the+event+up+to+15+minutes+before+the+start.%0D%0A%0D%0AEVENT+LINK%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fevent.on24.com%2Fwcc%2Fr%2F4685623%2F14D0EEA9C1A8556DCA90DF27CE7E9B83%20&location=Webinar&ctz=America/Los_Angeles]]> You can access your session 15 minutes before the start time. Suite 3A, 106 East Babcock Street, Bozeman, Montana 59715 You’re receiving this email because you’re signed up to receive updates from Snowflake. Dear Ayush,

Have you been working with DAX in Power BI but can’t entirely complete the calculations needed, or just want to expand your knowledge and utilize more of DAX's capabilities to bring your reports to the next level?

This bootcamp, starting on December 2, is perfect for you! In this in-depth DAX Bootcamp, all of your DAX knowledge will be enhanced to a point where you will have the tools to create any calculation that is possible within the DAX language.

Here’s what you’ll gain from this bootcamp:

- In-depth DAX Training: Learn the most essential and advanced DAX functions.

- Hands-on Practice: Apply what you learn through real-world scenarios and exercises.

- Better Data Models: Transform your Power BI reports with more powerful, dynamic insights.

- Expert Guidance: We will guide you through every step, helping you overcome challenges and learn faster.

DAX is one of the most potent tools in Power BI, and mastering it will help you create more insightful, actionable reports—skills that will set you apart in the workplace.

Ready to level up?

Register for the DAX Bootcamp today and take a huge step towards becoming a Power BI pro!

_______________________________________________________

We hope to see you there!

- Greg

Subject: ACM x CBRE Resume workshop, ACM x Visa Interview Prep workshop, hiring opportunities and more!
Message:
Hey ACM,

We have some great opportunities for you guys to check out this week:

ACM x CBRE - Resume building workshop

Join us for a *resume-building workshop with CBRE* , where we'll delve into creating an outstanding resume that will truly distinguish you from the rest. The event will also include a *Q&A session* , offering students the chance to gain valuable insights into CBRE and *what recruiters are searching for* in prospective candidates. This is also an exceptional opportunity to learn more about CBRE's summer technology internship program, which offers internships focused on Data Science, Product Management, UX Design, Cybersecurity, and Software Engineering. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to jumpstart your career with CBRE!

Join us *Wednesday* , *October 30* , *7:00 - 8:00 PM CST* at *FN 2.214*.

ACM Projects - Introduction to Web Development in React and Next.js

Looking for a job and want to expand your skillset? Want to make your own website as a personal project? Maybe even a personal portfolio? Join us for a workshop guiding you through how to create a website using React and an exciting and relatively new framework: Next.js!

Join us *Tuesday* , *November 5* , *7:00 PM CST* in *ECSW 1.315*.

ACM Industry - Technical and Behavioral Interview Prep with VISA!

Are you gearing up for upcoming job interviews? Join Visa for an insightful session on Technical and Behavioral Interview Preparation. Our *experienced speakers* will provide valuable tips and strategies to help you excel in both *technical assessments and behavioral questions*. There will be *free food, free swag, networking, and a fun game of Tech Jeopardy* to end the night. Don't miss this opportunity to network with Visa employees, enhance your interview techniques and land your dream job!

Join us *Wednesday* , *November 7* , *7:00 PM CST* in *ECSW 3.210*.

ACM Outreach: Hiring HS Hack Portal Devs!

We are *recruiting a team of web developers* to develop our portal for our annual HS hackathon! Get the opportunity to work on a 2 month project in a team setting. Previous web dev experience preferred, but not required. *Applications due on 11/8, midnight*. Application link ( https://forms.gle/8TeZgkDwuV6RH8oG8 ) !

HackUTD 2024 - Ripple Effect Registration

HackUTD Hackathon Registrations are still open! Dive in and secure your spot in this pond of innovation. Whether you are a coding tadpole or a tech-savvy fox, there's room for everyone in our digital forest. Don't hibernate on this opportunity - APPLY NOW ( https://ripple.hackutd.co/register ) !

Join us! *November 16 - 17th*.

Subject: Nikita Shrestha shared a post: ✨…
Message:
Nikita Shrestha shared a post: ✨ Game-Changing Takeaways for Business Transformation! ✨

What a phenomenal experience! Our recent event, Harnessing the Power of AI & Automation for Business Transformation, was a true showcase of the potential of 🤖 AI and ⚙️ automation. Industry experts and leaders joined us to share their insights, empowering attendees with the knowledge to drive efficiency, productivity, and innovation within their organizations.

🙏 A heartfelt thank you to all the speakers, attendees, and partners who made this event impactful and memorable.

#BitsKraft  #AIInnovation #AutomationTransformation #BusinessExcellence  #FutureOfBusiness  #DigitalInnovation   #AIandAutomation #nintex

Rudra Pandey shared a post: Lack of Professionalism Among Medical Doctors in Nepal

Feedback from users of Hamro Patro Health has highlighted troubling instances of unprofessional behavior among some medical doctors. Here are some of the key complaints:

1. Answering calls while driving – risking both their safety and professionalism.

2. Taking calls during meals at noisy, crowded restaurants – making it difficult to communicate effectively.

3. Appearing on video calls in casual attire, such as vests, with arms fully visible – lacking appropriate presentation.

4. Abruptly ending calls with “Call me back” without offering any explanation or guidance.

5. Missing scheduled calls entirely, despite giving specific times to patients.

6. Displaying rudeness during interactions with patients.

Hamro Patro Health is actively addressing these issues by gradually removing such doctors from our platform. It’s disappointing to see this kind of behavior from medical professionals. 

One would expect basic professionalism to be ingrained during their training in medical school.

Reading these patient complaints left me truly astonished. This level of disregard for professionalism is unacceptable and must be corrected.

Hamro Patro, Inc.

Subject: Congratulations! Welcome to HackUMass!
Message:
Hello Ayush,

Congratulations! You’ve been accepted to participate in HackUMass.

The event is from November 8th to 10th, 2024 at the Integrative Learning Center (ILC). In order to participate, make sure
you go to our website and RSVP!

If you have any questions please visit our website at https://u46976522.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.jgS1aaU7WTsFXZyNZqevQPYcw3sAPJAaiSJUjrNsISA-3D-V-G_Jaai3hjBhCCmSgaW3FR0XxfgpvY-2F2gq5OHvJedGChiRKYis1-2FzGjRehx4EKvEtXfGrwcs8BvXvT7vRwJE6cQ2S9GEPLPI94R3VL0BF59VMzjkIbAKhVDBtz-2BFP5ZKsR2xDD3dHpEaJqiJvxs3p08u1tnOxyfkiU1yQc4Ad8T7TNqXC-2Fp-2FwJcZ0SW7bDPGePcMxg6W-2B3d3NMbssZ36Pn2Ww-3D-3D If you can’t find
your answer on our website, then please feel free to shoot us an email at
team@hackumass.com and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can.


Thanks again for registering for our event, and we look forward to seeing you there!

- The HackUMass Team

Subject: ayush, follow Saaquib Dawoodani - Head of Business Recruitment, India at Rippling

The Enterprise Ready Conference is a one-day event in SF, bringing together product and engineering leaders shaping the future of enterprise SaaS. 
The event features a curated list of speakers with direct experience building for the enterprise, including OpenAI, Vanta, Checkr, Dropbox, and Canva.
Topics include advanced identity management, compliance, encryption, and logging — essential yet complex features that most enterprise customers require.
If you are a founder, exec, PM, or engineer tasked with the enterprise roadmap, this conference is for you. You’ll get detailed insights from industry leaders that have years of experience navigating the same challenges you face today. And best of all, it’s completely free since it’s hosted by WorkOS.
This week’s system design interview:
Big Data Pipeline Cheatsheet for AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud
A Cheatsheet on Comparing API Architectural Styles
10 Key Data Structures We Use Every Day
A Cheatsheet to Build Secure APIs
SPONSOR US
Big Data Pipeline Cheatsheet for AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud
Each platform offers a comprehensive suite of services that cover the entire lifecycle:
Ingestion: Collecting data from various sources
Data Lake: Storing raw data
Computation: Processing and analyzing data
Data Warehouse: Storing structured data
Presentation: Visualizing and reporting insights
AWS uses services like Kinesis for data streaming, S3 for storage, EMR for processing, RedShift for warehousing, and QuickSight for visualization.
Azure’s pipeline includes Event Hubs for ingestion, Data Lake Store for storage, Databricks for processing, Cosmos DB for warehousing, and Power BI for presentation.
GCP offers PubSub for data streaming, Cloud Storage for data lakes, DataProc and DataFlow for processing, BigQuery for warehousing, and Data Studio for visualization.
Over to you: What else would you add to the pipeline?
A Cheatsheet on Comparing API Architectural Styles
It covers the 6 most popular API architectural styles:
SOAP
REST
GraphQL
gRPC
WebSocket
Webhook
Over to you: Which other architectural style have you used?
200+ hours of research on Advanced AI Tools for Technical Leaders & Professionals (Sponsored) [ https://substack.com/redirect/af592cc3-01ca-41e5-8777-bbd9814e250e?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]
Imagine cutting hours of manual work, solving complex issues instantly, and having AI optimise your entire workflow—making you 10x more productive.
This FREE 3 hour Mini Crash Course on AI will help you save 16+ hours every week & put your 50% of your work on autopilot. 
Save your seat now (usually $399 but free for first 100 readers)
You will learn 20+ AI tools & use AI to:
Apply data-backed insights to drive faster, smarter decision-making
Streamline reporting, content generation, and operational processes in seconds
Detect performance bottlenecks in real time to keep systems running smoothly and efficiently.
Dynamically balance load in event-driven systems by routing traffic and predicting spikes, so you never need to adjust manually.
Accelerates big data processing by automating insights and flagging anomalies instantly for faster problem-solving, and much more!
By letting AI handle these critical tasks, you’ll save hours each week, unlock more time for strategic thinking & innovation and spend more time with family.
10 Key Data Structures We Use Every Day
list: keep your Twitter feeds 
stack: support undo/redo of the word editor 
queue: keep printer jobs, or send user actions in-game 
hash table: cashing systems 
Array: math operations 
heap: task scheduling 
tree: keep the HTML document, or for AI decision 
suffix tree: for searching string in a document 
graph: for tracking friendship, or path finding 
r-tree: for finding the nearest neighbor 
vertex buffer: for sending data to GPU for rendering 
Over to you: Which additional data structures have we overlooked?
A Cheatsheet to Build Secure APIs
An insecure API can compromise your entire application. Follow these strategies to mitigate the risk:
Using HTTPS
Encrypts data in transit and protects against man-in-the-middle attacks.
This ensures that data hasn’t been tampered with during transmission.
Rate Limiting and Throttling
Rate limiting prevents DoS attacks by limiting requests from a single IP or user.
The goal is to ensure fairness and prevent abuse.
Validation of Inputs
Defends against injection attacks and unexpected data format.
Validate headers, inputs, and payload
Authentication and Authorization
Don’t use basic auth for authentication. Instead, use a standard authentication approach like JWTs
Use a random key that is hard to guess as the JWT secret
Make token expiration short
For authorization, use OAuth
Using Role-based Access Control
RBAC simplifies access management for APIs and reduces the risk of unauthorized actions.
Granular control over user permission based on roles.
Monitoring
Monitoring the APIs is the key to detecting issues and threats early.
Use tools like Kibana, Cloudwatch, Datadog, and Slack for monitoring
Don’t log sensitive data like credit card info, passwords, credentials, etc.
Over to you: What else would you do to build a secure API?

Anil Khand shared a post: "Navigating Cultural Differences in Interviews"

Recently, I had two interviews that offered vastly different experiences. In one interview, I sensed the interviewer’s disinterest right from the start, apparently due to my choice of addressing her by her name rather than using "ma'am." This small difference seemed to impact the conversation, and the interview was quickly wrapped up in less than 10 minutes, citing an upcoming meeting.

As a newcomer to Australia, I’m continually learning and adapting to the cultural nuances in professional settings. While I understand that addressing someone respectfully can vary across cultures, it’s challenging when such differences affect opportunities.

I’m grateful for the learning experience and am more motivated than ever to keep moving forward, embracing both the challenges and successes along the way. For anyone else navigating similar situations, remember to stay resilient and adaptable. Every experience is a stepping stone toward the right opportunity.

Break Through Tech shared a post: Yesterday, we partnered with our long-time partner, Accenture, to host our first Break Through Tech Connect event! 🌟 Special guest Allie K. Miller one of the nation’s foremost voices in #AI innovation, advising, and investing, shared powerful insights on succeeding in this fast-evolving field.

Some takeaways: 
🔹 Learn by doing—real-world experience is everything.
🔹 Stay current by following industry trends (hint: follow the money!).
🔹 Focus on practical, business-driven applications of AI.
🔹 Watch for emerging regulations—they’ll shape the future of AI.

Thank you Allie, Laura Peterson, Lee Barrett, Teresa Tung for giving our students the tools to shape the future of tech! 

#WomenInTech #BreakThroughTech #AIProgram #FutureofAI #TechCareers

From: Harvard Project for Asian and International Relations <help@hpair.org>
Subject: HCONF 2025 Application Received
Message:
Dear Ayush﻿,

Thank you for submitting your HPAIR application. Please double check that
your name and date of birth you submitted are correct. *If everything looks
correct, there is no need to reply to this email. Otherwise, please
indicate if anything needs to be corrected.*

Email
First Name
Last Name
Confirm email
Date of Birth
ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com
Ayush
Pokharel
ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com
November 15, 2001 UTC

﻿

We know you must be very eager to hear back from us, just as much as we are
to speak with future delegates. While you wait to hear back from us, we ask
that you please be patient. HPAIR receives thousands of applications, and
each application is reviewed carefully by hand in the order they are
received. *Please do not resubmit your application — if you need to make
any changes, email us directly, and we will be happy to assist.*

If you haven't heard back from us yet, please do not resubmit another
application for HCONF 2025. If you have any questions, you can contact us
at help@hpair.org.

We look forward to being in touch shortly.

The HPAIR Team

Subject: Oct 29 AI Career Fair & AI Community LinkedIn Group
Message:
Hello!

Thank you for signing up for Northeastern University’s AI in Action Boot Camp. We are excited to share some additional AI resources within Northeastern and beyond.

  *   Please join our AI Community at Northeastern University LinkedIn Group<https://t.yesware.com/tt/21c8cff6a9125540c8f72467aa7a54d2bebd7ca4/e361d572811b55656e1ac36ac7dc0670/a805e10ed1de0b13e2c314fdfdfe9428/www.linkedin.com/groups/14304777/> hosted by The Institute for Experiential AI. This is a central hub for students, alumni, faculty, and staff to share AI events, news, opportunities, and more.
  *   You are invited to the AI Workforce Development and Career Fair<https://t.yesware.com/tt/21c8cff6a9125540c8f72467aa7a54d2bebd7ca4/e361d572811b55656e1ac36ac7dc0670/5266087cee3a585ff8979039e6bd11c5/massachusetts.workforcein.ai>:
  *   Location: Hynes Convention Center
     *   Date: Tuesday, October 29, 2024
     *   Time: 12PM - 5PM
     *   Northeastern affiliates get exclusive early access to the space at 11:30AM

Subscribe to our AI in the Loop<https://t.yesware.com/tt/21c8cff6a9125540c8f72467aa7a54d2bebd7ca4/e361d572811b55656e1ac36ac7dc0670/b6d3cae331a6083ee25942d2d9bb7efe/ai.northeastern.edu/subscribe-to-our-newsletter> newsletter for expert insights on fast-moving AI developments, AI events, news and more!

We hope to see you at Tuesday’s Career Fair. Stay tuned in the LinkedIn group<https://t.yesware.com/tt/21c8cff6a9125540c8f72467aa7a54d2bebd7ca4/e361d572811b55656e1ac36ac7dc0670/a805e10ed1de0b13e2c314fdfdfe9428/www.linkedin.com/groups/14304777/> for upcoming events and more!


The EAI Events Team

Subject: HackAI - Updated Timeline of Events  - HackAI - Dell and NVIDIA Challenge
Message:
( http://devpost.com )

Hello Hack AI devs!

We are very excited by the number and quality of projects submitted to the hackathon. We wanted to share with you all that we have decided to extend the judging period by a few weeks to accommodate more time for the judges to review the stellar projects we’ve received. Additionally, we are so pleased to announce that due to the high quality of projects, we have decided to update  Top 25 to Top 30!

Please see below for the updated remaining schedule for the hackathon. We will be in touch with the Top 30 soon on next steps.

Judging Period: October 11, 2024 (10:00 am Pacific Time) – November 1, 2024 (5:00 pm Pacific Time) (“Judging Period”).

Top 30 Projects Announced & Updated: November 4, 2024 (10:00 am Pacific Time) – November 15, 2024 (5:00 pm Pacific Time) (“Top 30 Period”).

Final Judging Period: November 18, 2024 (10:00 am Pacific Time) – November 27, 2024 (5:00 pm Pacific Time) (“Final Judging Period”).

Winners Announced: On or around December 2, 2024 (12:00 pm Pacific Time).

Good luck to everyone!

Questions?

If you have any questions about the hackathon, please post on the discussion forum ( https://hackaichallenge.devpost.com/forum_topics ).

You received this email because you signed up for HackAI - Dell and NVIDIA Challenge. If you're no longer participating, you can unregister here ( https://hackaichallenge.devpost.com/ ).

© 2024 Devpost, Inc. All rights reserved. Unsubscribe from these notifications ( https://devpost.com/notification_subscriptions/eSXgG5S0JnwQ8spICMoOMQ )

Subject: ⚡️ Meta Launches Mobile Llama 3.2: 4x Faster, 56% Smaller
Message:
On Meta, Anthropic, Perplexity, Cohere For AI, Google,
open-interpreter and many more.. 

SIGNUP [1]  |  ADVERTISE [2]  |  FOLLOW ON X [3]  |  READ
ON WEB [4]

ALPHASIGNAL

 . 

HEY ,

Welcome to today's edition of AlphaSignal, a newsletter for developers
by developers.

We identify and summarize the top 1% news, papers, models, and repos
in the AI industry. 

IN TODAY'S SIGNAL

_Read time: 6 min 58 sec_

🎖️ TOP NEWS

 	*
Meta Releases Mobile-Optimized Quantized Versions of Llama 3.2
[5]Models for On-Device AI.

📌 ASSEMBLY AI 

 	*
Early adoption days are over; leverage AssemblyAI’s Speech-to-Text
API [6] for SOTA performance.

⚡️ TRENDING SIGNALS

 	*
Anthropic launches code execution in Claude [7], enabling direct data
analysis and reproducible outputs.

 	*
Perplexity launches native macOS app [8], bringing AI search
capabilities offline for developers.

 	*
Cohere For AI releases Aya Expanse [9]: open-weights multilingual
models outperforming existing language-specific LLMs.

 	*
Google DeepMind releases MusicFX DJ [10], integrating real-time AI
music generation into Labs platform.

 	*
Open-Interpreter integrates Claude's computer control capabilities
[11], enabling direct system interactions across multiple LLMs.

📌 DEEP ATLAS

 	*
Learn AI/ML from first principles and level up your machine learning
[12] skills with this course.

🧠 TOP PAPERS

 	*
Looking Inward: Language Models Can Learn [13] About Themselves by
Introspection.

 	*
You need between 200-600 images to train AI for copying [14] an
artist's style (e.g. Van Gogh's artistic style ).

 	*
A Theoretical Understanding of Chain-of-Thought: [15] Coherent
Reasoning and Error-Aware Demonstration.

🧠 PYTHON TIP

 	*
Memory-efficient caching for deep learning using python's weakref
module.

IF YOU'RE ENJOYING ALPHASIGNAL PLEASE FORWARD THIS EMAIL TO A
COLLEAGUE. 

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

Multimodal Embedding Model

META RELEASES MOBILE-OPTIMIZED QUANTIZED VERSIONS OF LLAMA 3.2 MODELS
FOR ON-DEVICE AI

⇧ 4,377 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

Meta has launched quantized versions of Llama 3.2 1B and 3B models
designed to run directly on mobile devices, marking a shift from data
center-dependent AI to on-device processing. These models enable
direct deployment on phones and tablets while maintaining comparable
performance to their larger counterparts.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

 	*
First-ever mobile-optimized quantized Llama models with 2-4x speedup.

 	*
Dual quantization methods: QLoRA for accuracy, SpinQuant for
portability.

 	*
56% smaller model size, 41% less memory usage vs BF16.

 	*
8K token context support optimized for mobile constraints.

 	*
Direct deployment on Qualcomm/MediaTek SoCs with Arm CPUs.

 	*
ExecuTorch framework compatibility with full Hugging Face integration

KEY PERFORMANCE METRICS

 	*
2-4x faster inference speed vs original BF16 format.

 	*
56% reduction in model size.

 	*
41% decrease in memory usage.

 	*
2.5x improvement in decode latency.

 	*
4.2x improvement in prefill latency

TECHNICAL ARCHITECTURE

 	*
The quantization implementation combines two distinct approaches.

 	*
The primary method, Quantization-Aware Training with LoRA adapters
(QLoRA), simulates quantization effects during training while using
low-rank adaptation.

 	*
The secondary approach, SpinQuant, handles post-training quantization
using rotation matrices learned from WikiText calibration data,
offering a solution for scenarios without access to training datasets.

 	*
8K token context length limitation.

PRACTICAL IMPLEMENTATIONS

 	*
Testing on Android devices (OnePlus 12, Samsung S24+, Samsung S22)
demonstrates consistent performance across different hardware
configurations.

 	*
iOS compatibility is confirmed for accuracy but lacks detailed
performance benchmarks.

 	*
For developers, the implementation process integrates with existing
tools through ExecuTorch and Llama Stack. The models support both
direct deployment and further fine-tuning through LoRA adapters. 

		 READ MORE [5] 

		 [6] 

BUILD THE NEXT BIG THING WITH CONVERSATIONAL DATA

Speech AI now drives product strategy. The latest models deliver
higher accuracy and faster performance to maintain competitive
advantage.

ASSEMBLYAI'S SPEECH-TO-TEXT API DELIVERS

 	*
95% accuracy rate

 	*
30% reduction in hallucinations vs competitors

 	*
35-second processing time for 63-minute audio files

 	*
Native language detection and speaker separation

Start building robust voice applications with AssemblyAI's API now.

		 START BUILDING TODAY [6] 

_partner with us [16]_

TRENDING SIGNALS

Anthropic

ANTHROPIC LAUNCHES CODE EXECUTION IN CLAUDE, ENABLING DIRECT
DATA ANALYSIS AND REPRODUCIBLE OUTPUTS [7]

⇧ 6,466 Likes

Perplexity

PERPLEXITY LAUNCHES NATIVE MACOS APP, BRINGING AI SEARCH CAPABILITIES
OFFLINE FOR DEVELOPERS [8]

⇧ 1,800 Likes

LLM

COHERE FOR AI RELEASES AYA EXPANSE: OPEN-WEIGHTS MULTILINGUAL MODELS
OUTPERFORMING EXISTING LANGUAGE-SPECIFIC LLMS [9]

⇧ 390 Likes

Google

GOOGLE DEEPMIND RELEASES MUSICFX DJ, INTEGRATING REAL-TIME AI MUSIC
GENERATION INTO LABS PLATFORM [10]

⇧696 Likes

AI Computers Interface

OPEN-INTERPRETER INTEGRATES CLAUDE'S COMPUTER CONTROL CAPABILITIES,
ENABLING DIRECT SYSTEM INTERACTIONS ACROSS MULTIPLE LLMS [11]

⇧ 6,400 Likes

LEARN AI/ML FROM FIRST PRINCIPLES

Get hands-on machine learning experience with senior software
engineers. Learn to ship ML-powered features in just weeks. 

Now accepting applications from experienced developers for this
technical deep-dive into practical ML implementation.

APPLY NOW [12]

TOP PAPERS

LLM

LOOKING INWARD: LANGUAGE MODELS CAN LEARN ABOUT THEMSELVES BY
INTROSPECTION [13]

⇧ 1,140 Likes

PROBLEM
LLMs have been assumed to only use training data for knowledge
acquisition. This paper investigates whether LLMs can gain knowledge
through introspection - accessing information about themselves not
contained in or derivable from training data. They test if models can
predict their own behavior better than other models trained on the
same behavior data.

RESULTS
After finetuning GPT-4, GPT-4o and Llama-3-70B on self-prediction
tasks, models consistently outperform cross-prediction by other models
(17% higher accuracy for Llama-70B vs GPT-4o). Models show calibrated
predictions of their response distributions and can adapt predictions
when their behavior changes through additional finetuning. However,
introspection fails on complex tasks requiring longer outputs.

SOLUTION
The researchers developed a self-prediction training framework where
models predict properties of their hypothetical responses (e.g. "Would
your output be even or odd?"). They compare self-prediction accuracy
to cross-prediction by other models trained on the same behavior data.
The models are tested on held-out tasks after training.

Computer Vision

YOU NEED BETWEEN 200-600 IMAGES TO TRAIN AI FOR COPYING AN ARTIST'S
STYLE (E.G. VAN GOGH'S ARTISTIC STYLE ). [14]

⇧ 514 Likes

PROBLEM
Text-to-image models trained on internet-scraped datasets can imitate
copyrighted/private content, raising legal concerns. The paper studies
how many training images of a concept are needed for a model to
imitate it - the "imitation threshold".

SOLUTION
The authors propose MIMETIC2, a method to estimate imitation
thresholds without expensive model retraining. They analyze SD1.1,
SD1.5 and SD2.1 models across human faces and art styles domains by
comparing generated vs training images using domain-specific
similarity metrics.

RESULTS
The imitation threshold ranges between 200-600 images depending on
model and domain - 364 images for celebrity faces (SD1.1/1.5), 527 for
SD2.1. Art style thresholds are lower: 112-198 images (SD1.1/1.5),
185-241 (SD2.1). Results validate against human evaluation with
82.5-95% agreement.

Chain-of-Thought

A THEORETICAL UNDERSTANDING OF CHAIN-OF-THOUGHT: COHERENT REASONING
AND ERROR-AWARE DEMONSTRATION [15]

⇧ 487 Likes

PROBLEM
LLMs demonstrate strong reasoning with Chain-of-Thought (CoT)
prompting, but theoretical understanding remains limited. Previous
analyses treat reasoning steps in isolation (Stepwise ICL) rather than
as an integrated process. This fails to capture how real LLMs consider
the full context when predicting next tokens.

SOLUTION
The authors develop theoretical framework comparing Stepwise ICL to
"Coherent CoT" where later steps integrate earlier reasoning. They
analyze model sensitivity to errors in different reasoning steps and
propose incorporating both correct and incorrect reasoning paths in
prompts.

RESULTS
Coherent CoT achieves better error correction and prediction accuracy
than Stepwise ICL. Models are more sensitive to errors in intermediate
reasoning steps vs final outcomes. Experiments across multiple
datasets (BBH, GSM8K) and models (GPT-3.5/4, Gemini Pro, DeepSeek)
show incorporating incorrect reasoning examples with explanations
improves performance by up to 6.6%.

PYTHON TIP

MEMORY-EFFICIENT CACHING FOR DEEP LEARNING USING PYTHON'S WEAKREF
MODULE

You can store large tensors and intermediate results without worrying
about memory leaks. The cache automatically cleans up when Python's
garbage collector runs or when memory pressure increases.

CORE BENEFIT

weakref lets you cache model outputs without holding strong
references. When your original tensors get deleted, the cache entries
disappear automatically.

QUICK IMPLEMENTATION

import weakref
from typing import Dict, Any
import torch

class SmartCache:
    def __init__(self):
      self.cache: Dict[
          str, 
          Any
      ] = weakref.WeakValueDictionary()
    
    def store(self, key: str, tensor: torch.Tensor) -> None:
        self.cache[key] = tensor
    
    def get(self, key: str) -> torch.Tensor:
        return self.cache.get(key)

# Usage Example
model_cache = SmartCache()

# Create a large tensor
big_tensor = torch.randn(1000, 1000)

# Cache it
model_cache.store('layer1_output', big_tensor)

# Use it later
cached_tensor = model_cache.get('layer1_output')

# When big_tensor goes out of scope, 
#cache entry auto-deletes
del big_tensor

WHY THIS HELPS
The WeakValueDictionary holds weak references to your tensors. When
the original tensor's reference count hits zero, Python automatically
removes it from the cache, freeing memory.

WeakValueDictionary prevents memory leaks by auto-removing cached
tensors when they're no longer used, saving RAM during large model
inference without manual cleanup.

MAIN BENEFITS

 	*
No manual cache clearing needed

 	*
Memory gets freed automatically

 	*
Zero memory leaks

 	*
Works with any size tensor

 	*
Thread-safe cache management

Subject: MHacks 2024 on Slack: New Account Details
Message:
Welcome to your new workspace!

Here are the details for your new Slack workspace, MHacks 2024.

Workspace name: MHacks 2024

mhacks2024.slack.com []

Open Slack [https://mhacks2024.slack.com/x-p7696465902818-7935330710196-7926203833190/messages/C07LJU0771A]
Setting up your workspace

If you’ve used Slack before and have the basics down pat, here are a few ways to get even more out of your new workspace.

Connect your tools

Sync your calendar, run polls, share files, and much more, by connecting Slack to any of the 2,000+ apps in our Slack Marketplace [https://mhacks2024.slack.com/x-p7696465902818-7935330710196-7926203833190/apps?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-existing-join].

Fine-tune your notifications

Keep track of the projects and conversations that matter most to you by customizing notifications in Slack [https://mhacks2024.slack.com/x-p7696465902818-7935330710196-7926203833190/help/categories/360000047906-Your-profile-preferences?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-existing-join#adjust-your-notifications].

Add your workspace to the Slack app

Sign in on our mobile and desktop apps [https://mhacks2024.slack.com/x-p7696465902818-7935330710196-7926203833190/downloads?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-existing-join&t=T07LGDPSJQ2] to stay notified on all your workspaces, so you never miss a message.

See more tips [https://mhacks2024.slack.com/x-p7696465902818-7935330710196-7926203833190/resources/using-slack/top-5-tips-for-getting-started-in-slack?utm_medium=email&utm_source=confirmation-existing-join]

Have questions about your new workspace? Drop us a note at help@slack.com. We’re glad you’re here!

Subject: Thank you for signing up for HackUMass XII!
Message:
Hi Ayush,

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

Multimodal Embedding Model

COHERE LAUNCHES NEW AI MODEL THAT UNIFIES TEXT AND IMAGE SEARCH IN
SINGLE VECTOR SPACE

⇧ 3,486 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

Cohere's Multimodal Embed 3 creates a unified embedding space for both
text and images, enabling direct cross-modal search and retrieval. The
model represents a shift from traditional single-modality embeddings
by allowing direct comparison between text and visual content without
separate processing pipelines.

KEY FEATURES:

 	*
Unified vector space for both text and image embeddings.

 	*
Places text and image embeddings in same vector space. i.e. here Text
and image encoders share single unified space.

 	*
Support for 100+ languages with maintained performance.

 	*
Available on major platforms (Azure AI, AWS SageMaker, VPC
deployment).

 	*
Direct cross-modal search without modality bias.

 	*
Optimized for enterprise-scale deployment.

MODEL ARCHITECTURE 

 	*
The model's architecture places both text and image embeddings in the
same high-dimensional vector space, enabling similarity comparisons
across modalities.

 	*
This eliminates the common problem of modality clustering, where text
and image data separate into distinct regions. 

 	*
The system demonstrated superior performance in mixed-modality
searches, outperforming CLIP when retrieving relevant images in the
presence of text distractors.

STRONG PERFORMANCE METRICS

 	*
The model achieved top scores in text-to-image retrieval (Recall@10)
and text-to-text search (NDCG@10) across the BEIR dataset suite. 

 	*
Testing on multilingual content, including infographics with text in
11 different languages, confirmed consistent cross-lingual
performance.

 	*
In benchmark tests using the Flickr image corpus with added text
distractors, it maintained high retrieval accuracy while competing
models showed significant performance degradation when dealing with
cross-modal queries.

IMPLEMENTATION AND USE CASES

Technical implementation focuses on three primary use cases:
graph/chart search based on semantic descriptions, e-commerce product
discovery combining visual and textual queries, and design asset
retrieval. The system integrates with existing infrastructure through
standard API calls, requiring minimal setup for deployment.

Real-world applications

Real-world applications demonstrate practical value in enterprise
settings. The system efficiently processes complex reports, technical
documentation, and visual assets, providing accurate retrieval across
modalities. Response times and computational requirements align with
production environment needs, though specific performance metrics
weren't disclosed.

INVEST IN RYSE [12]

TOP LECTURES

AI Agent

BUILD REAL-WORLD MULTI-AGENT SYSTEMS FOR BUSINESS AUTOMATION WITH
CREWAI [13]

⇧ 1,100 Likes

Learn to build multi-agent systems using crewAI. You'll master
parallel and sequential agent configurations, integrate external
tools, test performance, and implement human feedback loops. Build
practical applications like automated project planners and lead
scoring systems. Work with multiple LLMs, optimize agent-specific
tasks, and prepare deployments in production environments.

AI Agent

BUILD PERSISTENT MEMORY AGENTS IN LANGGRAPH: CROSS-SESSION DATA
RETENTION MADE SIMPLE [14]

⇧ 286 Likes

Learn how LangGraph adds persistent memory across multiple chat
sessions in your AI agents. Build agents that store, retrieve, and
search memories as JSON documents using namespaces. The tutorial
covers practical implementation in both Python and JavaScript, with
working examples of memory-enabled chatbots that retain user context
between conversations.

Prompt Engineering

FEED ENTIRE REPOSITORIES TO CHATGPT AND CLAUDE WITH REPOPACK'S
STREAMLINED PACKING [15]

⇧ 1,100 Likes

Learn how to prepare your codebase for LLM analysis using Repopack.
Pack entire repositories into single AI-readable files with built-in
token counting and security checks. Configure input/output formats,
handle remote repositories, and use XML/Markdown structures for better
AI comprehension. Supports multiple programming languages and respects
.gitignore rules.

DEEP DIVE

LLM

STANFORD'S COMPLETE ROADMAP FOR TRAINING PRODUCTION-READY LLMS

⇧ 3,129 Likes

This Stanford lecture teaches you how to build LLMs through these key
steps:

PRE-TRAINING PHASE

 	*
Learn auto-regressive language modeling

 	*
Understand tokenization (BPE method)

 	*
Master cross-entropy loss calculation

 	*
Track model progress through perplexity

POST-TRAINING PHASE (AFTER CHATGPT ERA)

 	*
Convert base models into AI assistants

 	*
Apply evaluation benchmarks like MMLU

 	*
Handle train-test contamination issues

TECHNICAL COMPONENTS

 	*
Select proper model architecture

 	*
Implement training algorithms

 	*
Process training data

 	*
Set up evaluation metrics

 	*
Build system infrastructure

The lecture skips deep architecture details to focus on practical
training aspects, data handling, and evaluation methods.

Subject: Your next opportunity awaits
[Model Launch] Welcome Cohere For AI’s Aya Expanse to Kaggle (& Join Our AMA With the Cohere Team)!
Message:
Kaggle








Hi ayush pokharel,

Kaggle is thrilled to announce that Cohere For AI's Aya Expanse model is  
now available on Kaggle through our model hub.

Aya Expanse is the product of more than two years of open science research,  
including a series of breakthroughs in data arbitrage, preference training  
for performance and safety, and model merging. The 23 languages available  
in the new model reflect collaborations with over 3000 researchers from 119  
countries, resulting in the Aya collection, Aya-101, and critical  
evaluation sets.





Access Aya Expanse



On October 31st, Kaggle will be hosting Senior Research Scientists Marzieh  
Fadaee and Ahmet Üstün for a conversation with the Kaggle community about  
the model, and the research that made it possible. Mark your calendars for  
October 31st, 11AM to view our YouTube livestream and submit your questions  
here.

We can't wait to chat!

Brenda Flynn

Model Partnerships Lead



Kaggle, Inc 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy Mountain View, CA 94043

This email was sent to ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com because you indicated that  
you'd like to receive news and updates about Kaggle. If you don't want to  
receive these emails in the future, please unsubscribe here. You can also  
change your preferences on your account's profile page by logging in at  
kaggle.com.

Subject: Event-Driven Architectural Patterns
Message:
View this post on the web at https://blog.bytebytego.com/p/event-driven-architectural-patterns

Event-driven architecture (EDA) is a software design approach emphasizing the production, detection, consumption, and reaction to events. In this architecture, events are state changes or updates within a system. 
EDA is particularly beneficial in modern software development because it can decouple services, enhance scalability, and improve responsiveness. 
By allowing systems to react to events asynchronously, EDA supports real-time processing and enables systems to handle high volumes of data efficiently. This approach is useful in distributed systems and microservices architectures, where different components must operate independently yet cohesively.
The importance of EDA in today's software landscape cannot be overstated. It offers significant advantages such as:
Improved fault tolerance because systems can continue operating even if some components fail. 
Better resource utilization by enabling services to scale independently based on demand. 
Supports dynamic and flexible workflows, allowing businesses to adapt quickly to changing requirements and market conditions.
In this article, we’ll explore various patterns used in event-driven architecture. By examining these patterns, the aim is to gather insights into how they can be applied to build robust, scalable, and responsive systems.

Subject: HRT Application Status - Ayush Pokharel
Message:
Hi Ayush,

We want to thank you very much for your interest in Hudson River Trading. Right now, however, we have decided not to move forward with your application for our Software Engineering Internship – 2025 role.

We would encourage you to stay in touch with us, because as HRT grows, it's possible our hiring needs will change. We're always eager to network with smart candidates with an interest in our industry.

Thanks again for your interest and time, and good luck with your job search.

Regards,

Hudson River Trading
