. This dynamic duo’s work with HRPA and the HR Congress
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/ohzh6KooYhg1SlkhWjbfoVy5sxzid7oZu92KHo0TpXU-SNhwg609mK3PDovKXaZL1X65dhu135JRYOhSHGwNTg.b34C1KJ0iv6PQ2xuJ2vRDA.Jo7pGXhXB4KtqZj_Dgf0qdanPNZgnyYZOJ8GJ3-lvVUEOEDCMmsD-K_07dI4v-D-T_DRHk3eM7p1dt_N71tbpHwQ8wdpRgTGYRlhR4DX5cTa7dYxM3PI9RhIH6tQ-k7eScMg1UWrzK0dDrjN3AgCXd39PaqxRmIh8HiKD7BOXehL-8L749rQnivCHBavUbEnWWAr3u6y8Gf8XyDLx_WCMcJf3EBZwj9RUQXaJEaztNlKskq4lPtgI6fAJyidj8bG1_D42t_m4o0uvly5WZxZq9lPOLrKaHljQR-NXlCfY1Kon9AZsBkJrH09NXMiU9cYxutSHODkYOvrAudnEMDcwM8vLVuPOo4eI-oEjvmFLi-GISwqG7Zu2401DhpiCoOibw0ZCdp98dO1lgcFBi-FwJ9W1YnviWXP2npXXPfSvjRuOEqTASbPc26JgW_w6LjtJGcAAiNSyEJnWalop2WDrBfZ3DjOTabY0uJ8S6ZP6v9IZrL-pV0Z5QKT6tyCH73mln9Oupiino0zEvoSky43ufiQ5DjjIKwnylipTtIaYdXqFcNMZkDo9stctZdD-wbAKsSWO2tEQRKPvy6NofA4G9z3ctLTaKt_kVjKvkPUVXihpSxIkgy78Rvsej-UlfA5wZM83OmKFNfHYoKxLJQmRhyDcXta657GFJYswKoyXBY> 
enables them to serve potentiators, helping Georgian institutions connect 
with and leverage global educational networks. Their efforts showcase how 
targeted leadership—and Human Relations expertise—can significantly impact 
a country's educational trajectory.


What has been particularly interesting throughout this journey is observing 
the varied approaches universities take towards global outreach and 
connectivity. Some forward-thinking institutions eagerly embrace platforms 
like Coursera, recognizing them as powerful tools for broadening their 
impact and keeping both students and faculty at the forefront of their 
fields. These universities see the potential for continuous learning and 
the cross-pollination of ideas on a global scale.


In contrast, other institutions hold fast to more traditional models, 
prioritizing their established internal programs and local networks. While 
this approach has its merits, it can inadvertently limit opportunities for 
growth and innovation. Curiously, within these more conservative 
institutions, administrators will often privately acknowledge challenges in 
encouraging their faculty to upskill, with students sometimes outstripping 
the expertise of the faculty in cutting-edge fields.


However, it's important to note that universities' efforts to connect 
internationally are not always solely determined by their own choices. In 
some cases, institutions find themselves constrained by outdated 
governmental regulations that were sometimes established long before the 
critical importance of global academic connections became apparent. These 
legacy policies can inadvertently hamper universities' ability to fully 
engage in the international academic community, creating barriers to 
collaboration and knowledge exchange that are so vital in today's 
interconnected world.


The advent of online learning platforms has dramatically shifted the 
landscape of higher education. Where universities once had limited options 
for facilitating widespread upskilling and inter-institutional 
collaboration, they now have straightforward access to a global network of 
knowledge and expertise. This shift opens new avenues for continuous 
learning and development, challenging institutions to reconsider their 
approach to education in an increasingly connected world.


Barb to give the President’s Colloquium Speehc Nov 5 at Oakland University, 
Rochester, Michigan


I’ve been invited to give the President’s Colloquium Speech at Oakland 
University on November 5th. The reception is at the Oakland Center Banquet 
Rooms at 11:30 am, with the presentation at noon: “Neural Insights for 
Dazzling Teaching in an Era of Generative AI.”  To inquire as to whether 
there might be a spot remaining for you to attend, reach out to Patricia 
Gillespie gillesp2@oakland.edu <mailto:gillesp2@oakland.edu> .


Barb on "Office Hours with Elle": From Antarctica to AI


I recently sat down with Elle Wang for her podcast "Office Hours with Elle" 
to discuss my journey from linguist to educator. We explored how my varied 
experiences—from working as a Russian translator in the Bering Sea to my 
time in Antarctica—have influenced my approach to learning and teaching. 
The conversation also delved into practical tips for using AI to enhance 
learning. If you're interested in hearing some entertaining stories 
(including why vodka and ship navigation don't mix!) and gaining insights 
on modern learning techniques, tune in to our episode "Dr. Barbara Oakley 
- From Antarctica to AI: Learning How to Learn" on YouTube,

AI: The Misunderstood Educational Superhero


I absolutely love Brandon Hendrickson's work at Science Is WEIRD! While 
many fear AI in education, Brandon reveals its true potential as 
educational dynamite. Inspired by Kieran Egan's philosophy, Brandon 
demonstrates how AI can speak 'human', using metaphors, vivid imagery, and 
even nonsense to bring science to life. It's not about dry facts; it's 
about rekindling our connection to reality's inherent weirdness. Through 
his innovative AI-powered livestreams
<https://eventing.coursera.org/redirect/bePU9ejHUZXrpOiKoYJ3jaAOBQNjXhxEYqDi_69DewuWeSHYJ8nU_uwDzIDHnwowAanY31hRAN4y8kCjPaqZ9A.n_FNQX1pWQRWaiv1MkyQBw.9MVRiPo3grI5f_v4SFfgo3uq4gzr78LpYVKmUZ3aADj3N7M0hvPd64ZzA_d8Ex1ryY9ctQkhx8024EiIIEl6_NNmBz_ccrG8rNUSbnWN0pUJQwR2SmcbkeV5-Pwl-ZfmeXea61inULaFWGNcXXV-te2f0u_k-btvNDv2GLmttv-wfwgydFqeNv4ocZHYFH_8t5HANTA1lH-xHxiLSIPXlxhH9ZaXz-iVSVRZGv-ltyhSIrtX_KJ_twk7UA6If8isruADB1XAlnJNbql4qZceT21nqYBsXkiRzwGLzmEe71KklyP_odXK2fH6k6N8b3SG7mFbiQHi9aGhEcJCirT3b2Ah8pN5RyYX_zAbWI3O8nyCNSeS859mSdfpQHtiMzzeok2XaUlhMBsvYlkimzZuJv1uusqIn_KA-E6VcMFnifrzxbG-AZR9M9l4jfiMTLotdmSXJhzxL5Yy8IvZQIIP7WdTd33_UchzpEEyPGbuF6F9u9Wxuh8hJoGICJE_qnLz9lTFMtaUU-Ij0NY1s0-hnP5CF-q_rWer9tlMw04ELBF5jpVLE7J7dXIKV_zrxAb3_wfGxaBcpclZG6-Z7_YQURBRc8bnqGMMkwKVVAePkcoz9bRtmiJYEhi4oXCCzP5f4ptJbjTOjY9zjayqfQqFvFngieOb_01_R3ehbh4cK7Q> 
, Brandon shows that AI, wielded with Egan's tools, isn't just safe - it's 
revolutionary. His work is a brilliant example of how fusing new tech with 
old tools can transform science education. Brandon's approach is truly 
inspiring, making learning weird, wonderful, and deeply engaging!


That’s all for now. Have a happy week in learning!

Subject: EP134: What do Amazon, Netflix, and Uber have in common?
Message:

Scalability Simply Explained in 10 Minutes (Youtube video)
What do Amazon, Netflix, and Uber have in common?

How does Git Work? 
What tech stack is commonly used for microservices?

Oct 23-24 | Online
Scalability Simply Explained in 10 Minutes
What do Amazon, Netflix, and Uber have in common? 
They are extremely good at scaling their system whenever needed. 
Here are 8 must-know strategies to scale your system. 
Stateless Services 
Design stateless services because they don’t rely on server-specific data and are easier to scale. 
Horizontal Scaling 
Add more servers so that the workload can be shared. 
Load Balancing 
Use a load balancer to distribute incoming requests evenly across multiple servers. 
Auto Scaling 
Implement auto-scaling policies to adjust resources based on real-time traffic. 
Caching 
Use caching to reduce the load on the database and handle repetitive requests at scale. 
Database Replication 
Replicate data across multiple nodes to scale the read operations while improving redundancy. 
Database Sharding 
Distribute data across multiple instances to scale the writes as well as reads. 
Async Processing 
Move time-consuming and resource-intensive tasks to background workers using async processing to scale out new requests. 
Over to you: Which other strategies have you used?

What are the differences between paging and segmentation?
Paging 
Paging is a memory management scheme that eliminates the need for contiguous allocation of physical memory. The process's address space is divided into fixed-size blocks called pages, while physical memory is divided into fixed-size blocks called frames. 
 
The address translation process works in 3 steps: 
Logical Address Space: The logical address (generated by the CPU) is divided into a page number and a page offset. 
Page Table Lookup: The page number is used as an index into the page table to find the corresponding frame number. 
Physical Address Formation: The frame number is combined with the page offset to form the physical address in memory. 
Advantages: 
Eliminates external fragmentation. 
Simplifies memory allocation. 
Supports efficient swapping and virtual memory. 
Segmentation 
Segmentation is a memory management technique where the memory is divided into variable-sized segments based on the logical divisions of a program, such as functions, objects, or data arrays. 
 
The address tranlation process works in 3 steps: 
Logical Address Space: The logical address consists of a segment number and an offset within that segment. 
Segment Table Lookup: The segment number is used as an index into the segment table to find the base address of the segment. 
Physical Address Formation: The base address is added to the offset to form the physical address in memory. 
Advantages: 
Provides logical separation of different parts of a program. 
Facilitates protection and sharing of segments. 
Simplifies management of growing data structures. 
How does Git Work? 
The diagram below shows the Git workflow. 
Git is a distributed version control system. 
 
Every developer maintains a local copy of the main repository and edits and commits to the local copy. 
 
The commit is very fast because the operation doesn’t interact with the remote repository. 
 
If the remote repository crashes, the files can be recovered from the local repositories. 
 
Over to you: Which Git command do you use to resolve conflicting changes?
What tech stack is commonly used for microservices?
Below you will find a diagram showing the microservice tech stack, both for the development phase and for production.
Pre-Production
Define API - This establishes a contract between frontend and backend. We can use Postman or OpenAPI for this.
Development - Node.js or react is popular for frontend development, and java/python/go for backend development. Also, we need to change the configurations in the API gateway according to API definitions.
Continuous Integration - JUnit and Jenkins for automated testing. The code is packaged into a Docker image and deployed as microservices.
Production
NGinx is a common choice for load balancers. Cloudflare provides CDN (Content Delivery Network).
API Gateway - We can use spring boot for the gateway, and use Eureka/Zookeeper for service discovery.
The microservices are deployed on clouds. We have options among AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google GCP.
Cache and Full-text Search - Redis is a common choice for caching key-value pairs. ElasticSearch is used for full-text search.
Communications - For services to talk to each other, we can use messaging infra Kafka or RPC.
Persistence - We can use MySQL or PostgreSQL for a relational database, and Amazon S3 for object store. We can also use Cassandra for the wide-column store if necessary.
Management & Monitoring - To manage so many microservices, the common Ops tools include Prometheus, Elastic Stack, and Kubernetes.
Over to you: Did I miss anything? Please comment on what you think is necessary to learn microservices.

Subject: 🚀 DeepSeek Unveils Janus: Beats DALL-E 2 & SDXL in Generation
Message:
On DeepSeek, PyTorch, Google, FireAttention v3, MotherDuck, Meta and
many more.. 

SIGNUP [1]  |  ADVERTISE [2]  |  FOLLOW ON X [3]  |  READ
ON WEB [4]

ALPHASIGNAL

 . 

HEY ,

Welcome to today's edition of AlphaSignal, a newsletter for developers
by developers.

We identify and summarize the top 1% news, papers, models, and repos
in the AI industry. 

IN TODAY'S SIGNAL

_Read time: 6 min 25 sec_

🎖️ TOP NEWS

 	*
Deepseek releases Janus, an Any-to-Any  autoregressive framework [5]
for multimodal AI.

📌 OXYLABS

 	*
OxyCopilot by Oxylabs: AI-powered assistant for request code
generation [6] and parsing instructions without manual coding.

⚡️ TRENDING SIGNALS

 	*
PyTorch releases version 2.5, offering up to 2x speedup [7] for Scaled
dot product attention on H100 GPUs

 	*
Google unveils Kaggle competition [8] for developers to leverage
Gemini's extended context capabilities with large reward.

 	*
Fireworks AI unveils FireAttention v3 [9], enabling 80% more
throughput on AMD MI300 GPUs.

 	*
MotherDuck introduces prompt() SQL function [10], integrating SLMs for
cost-effective text processing at scale.

 	*
Meta unveils open-source CoTracker3 [11], achieving state-of-the-art
results in long-term point tracking.

📌 NEO4J

 	*
NODES 2024: A 24-hour virtual conference on knowledge graphs and AI,
free to attend [12]. Happening on November 7

🧠 TOP PAPERS

 	*
Thinking LLMs: [13] General Instruction Following with Thought
Generation

 	*
Agent-as-a-Judge [14]: Evaluate Agents with Agents

 	*
Scaling Laws For Diffusion Transformers [15]

🧠 PYTHON TIP

 	*
Boost ML performance with partial function application and result
memoization

IF YOU'RE ENJOYING ALPHASIGNAL PLEASE FORWARD THIS EMAIL TO A
COLLEAGUE. 

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

Multimodal

DEEPSEEK RELEASES JANUS, AN ANY-TO-ANY  AUTOREGRESSIVE FRAMEWORK FOR
MULTIMODAL AI

⇧ 1,275 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

DeepSeek has introduced Janus, an autoregressive framework that
unifies multimodal understanding and generation. Janus addresses
limitations of previous models by decoupling visual encoding into
separate pathways while using a unified transformer for processing.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

 	*
Janus 1.3B is a multi-modal LM for any-to-any tasks. It beats DALL-E
2/SDXL in generation and LLaVA 1.5 7B in multimodal capability.

 	*
MIT licensed, Commercial usage is permitted under these terms.

 	*
Achieves 69.4 on MMBench, 63.7 on SEED-Bench, 87.0 on POPE.

 	*
FID score of 8.53 on MSCOCO-30K, 61% accuracy on GenEval.

 	*
Model available in HuggingFace and integrated with Tansformers
library.

PERFORMANCE METRICS

Strong performance is demonstrated by the 1.3B parameter model,
outperforming models with 7B parameters.

 	*
MMBench: 69.4 (outperforms LLaVA-v1.5 7B: 67.9)

 	*
SEED-Bench: 63.7 (outperforms LLaVA-v1.5 7B: 62.4)

 	*
POPE: 87.0 (outperforms LLaVA-v1.5 7B: 85.5)

 	*
MSCOCO-30K: FID score of 8.53 (outperforms DALL-E 2: 9.0)

 	*
GenEval: Accuracy of 61% (outperforms SDXL: 58%)

THREE-STAGE TRAINING PROCEDURE

 	*
Janus employs distinct encoders for understanding and generation
tasks. 

 	*
The model's training follows a three-stage procedure: adaptor and
image head training, unified pretraining, and supervised
fine-tuning. 

 	*
This approach allows Janus to balance performance between
understanding and generation tasks effectively.

MODEL ARCHITECTURE

 	*
Janus uses an autoregressive transformer architecture with separate
visual encoders for understanding and generation. 

 	*
For multimodal understanding, it uses a SigLIP encoder to extract
high-dimensional semantic features. 

 	*
Visual generation relies on a VQ tokenizer to convert images into
discrete IDs. Both pathways feed into a shared transformer for
autoregressive processing.

		 READ MORE [5] 

		 [6] 

BUILD SCRAPERS LIKE A PRO WITH OXYCOPILOT BY OXYLABS

Developers with limited coding skills can now use Oxylabs' AI-driven
OxyCopilot.

This tool builds scalable web scrapers and parsers, leveraging
Oxylabs' scraping infrastructure.

OXYCOPILOT FEATURES

 	*
AI-powered parsing of complex HTML into structured data

 	*
Quick adaptation to website layout changes

 	*
Precise extraction of nested and listed data

 	*
Reusable JSON-formatted parsing templates

OxyCopilot streamlines scraping tasks in no time and with little
effort, allowing developers to focus on core business logic.

		 TRY FOR FREE [6] 

_partner with us [16]_

TRENDING SIGNALS

PyTorch

PYTORCH RELEASES VERSION 2.5, OFFERING UP TO 2X SPEEDUP FOR SCALED DOT
PRODUCT ATTENTION ON H100 GPUS [7]

⇧ 2,330 Likes

Google

GOOGLE UNVEILS KAGGLE COMPETITION FOR DEVELOPERS TO LEVERAGE GEMINI'S
EXTENDED CONTEXT CAPABILITIES WITH LARGE REWARD [8]

⇧ 821 Likes

Transformers

FIREWORKS AI UNVEILS FIREATTENTION V3, ENABLING 80% MORE THROUGHPUT ON
AMD MI300 GPUS [9]

⇧ 638 Likes

SQL

MOTHERDUCK INTRODUCES PROMPT() SQL FUNCTION, INTEGRATING SLMS FOR
COST-EFFECTIVE TEXT PROCESSING AT SCALE [10]

⇧ 3,896 Likes

Meta

META UNVEILS OPEN-SOURCE COTRACKER3, ACHIEVING STATE-OF-THE-ART
RESULTS IN LONG-TERM POINT TRACKING [11]

⇧ 1,888 Likes

JOIN NODES: FREE CONFERENCE ON KNOWLEDGE GRAPHS + AI

Neo4j's 24-hour virtual developer conference starts November 7. 

Explore 140+ sessions on knowledge graphs, AI, data science, and
intelligent apps. 

Learn from experts, build skills, and discover real-world use cases.

REGISTER NOW [FREE] [12]

TOP PAPERS

LLM

THINKING LLMS: GENERAL INSTRUCTION FOLLOWING WITH THOUGHT GENERATION
[13]

⇧ 1,670 Likes

PROBLEM
LLMs lack explicit thinking abilities for complex reasoning tasks.
Existing methods like chain-of-thought are limited to math and logic
problems and require human-written examples.

SOLUTION
Thought Preference Optimization (TPO) trains LLMs to generate internal
thoughts before responding, without additional human data. It uses
iterative preference optimization to explore and improve thought
generation based on response quality judged by a separate model.

RESULTS
TPO outperforms direct response baselines on general instruction
following benchmarks AlpacaEval (52.5% vs 48.4% win rate) and
Arena-Hard (37.3% vs 33.0%). Gains are seen across diverse categories
beyond traditional reasoning tasks, including creative writing,
marketing, and general knowledge.

AI Agents

AGENT-AS-A-JUDGE: EVALUATE AGENTS WITH AGENTS [14]

⇧ 885 Likes

PROBLEM
Current evaluation methods for agentic AI systems are inadequate,
focusing only on final outcomes or requiring excessive manual labor.
This fails to capture the step-by-step nature of agentic systems and
slows progress.

SOLUTION
The authors introduce the Agent-as-a-Judge framework, where agentic
systems evaluate other agentic systems. This extends LLM-as-a-Judge to
provide rich, intermediate feedback on the entire task-solving
process. They also present DevAI, a new benchmark of 55 realistic AI
development tasks with 365 hierarchical requirements.

RESULTS
Agent-as-a-Judge outperformed LLM-as-a-Judge, aligning 90% with human
consensus vs 70% for LLM-as-a-Judge. It performed comparably to human
evaluators while saving 97% of time and cost. On DevAI, top agentic
systems satisfied ~29% of task requirements but fully solved only one
task.

Diffusion Transformers

 SCALING LAWS FOR DIFFUSION TRANSFORMERS [15] [17]

⇧ 783 Likes

PROBLEM
The paper identifies the absence of explicit scaling laws for
Diffusion Transformers (DiT) in text-to-image generation, which
results in inefficient resource allocation. Current models lack
precise predictions for optimal model size and data requirements,
leading to costly heuristic searches.

SOLUTION
The authors establish scaling laws for DiT by conducting experiments
across a wide range of compute budgets. They derive a power-law
relationship between compute, model size, data, and training loss,
allowing predictions of optimal configurations. A 1B-parameter model
trained with 1.5e21 FLOPs validates these scaling laws.

RESULTS
The scaling laws accurately predict training loss and synthesis
quality, with a close match between predicted and actual losses for a
1B-parameter model. The relationship between compute budget and FID
follows a power-law trend, demonstrating effective performance
prediction across datasets.

PYTHON TIP

BOOST ML PERFORMANCE WITH PARTIAL FUNCTION APPLICATION AND RESULT
MEMOIZATION

Optimize your Python function calls for ML tasks with
functools.partial and functools.lru_cache.

These tools help you reduce redundant computations and improve
performance in data-heavy operations.

FUNCTOOLS.PARTIAL lets you create new functions with pre-set
arguments. 

FUNCTOOLS.LRU_CACHE memoizes function results, storing them for quick
retrieval on subsequent calls with the same arguments. This speeds up
expensive computations.

Here's a practical example:

from functools import partial, lru_cache
import numpy as np

@lru_cache(maxsize=128)
def expensive_computation(x, y):
    return np.sum(np.power(np.arange(x), y))

partial_compute = partial(
    expensive_computation, y=2)

# Usage
result1 = partial_compute(1000000)
result2 = partial_compute(1000000) #Cached result

print(f"Result 1: {result1}")
print(f"Result 2: {result2}")
# Result 1: 333332833333500000
# Result 2: 333332833333500000

This code demonstrates how partial pre-sets the 'y' argument, while
lru_cache stores results for repeated calls.

WITHOUT PARTIAL AND LRU_CACHE

1. You'd need to specify y=2 every time you call the function.
2. The expensive computation would run from scratch on each call, even
with identical inputs.

This results in more verbose code and slower execution.

So the benefit of using partial and lru_cache is significant speedup
for repeated expensive computations on large arrays.

Subject: Top companies are looking for you on WayUp!

From: "Glisery, Director of Graduate Admission, Bentley University" <applygrad@bentley.edu>
Subject: Bentley's Distinctive Graduate Programs Provide the Skills Employers Seek
Message:
Hi Ayush,

                        I am excited to share an overview of the MS in Business Analytics offered at Bentley University. The program is designed to provide students like you with a comprehensive and dynamic learning experience, tailored to meet your career goals and equip you with the skills demanded by today's employers.

                        Here are some key highlights of our program:                      

	 Diverse Career Opportunities: Our program is designed to meet the needs of employers in the analytics field, ensuring strong career prospects upon graduation.                        
	 Comprehensive Curriculum: With six clusters including data science, economics, finance, information management, management, and marketing, our program draws upon Bentley's extensive experience in analytics to offer a deep and comprehensive learning experience.                        
	 Flexible Study Options: You have the flexibility to pursue the program on a full-time or part-time basis, allowing you to tailor your studies to your personal and professional commitments.                        
	 Cutting-Edge Learning Labs: Benefit from our state-of-the-art learning labs, such as the User Experience Center and the Computer Information Systems Sandbox, where you'll have access to the latest hardware and software tools.                        
	 Center for Analytics and Data Science (CADS): Leverage the resources of Bentley's Center for Analytics and Data Science, which hosts regular workshops and networking events specifically for analytics students.                        
	 STEM Designation: The MSBA program holds STEM designation, providing international students with the advantage of three years of Optional Practical Training (OPT), which enhances their employability.                        


                        Feel free to reach out to me. I'd be happy to share more exciting information about the program.                      


BEGIN APPLICATION <https://www.bentley.edu/graduate/apply>

                        Sincerely,

                        Glisery Colón
                        Director of Graduate Admission                      


 


This email was sent to ayush.pokharel8@gmail.com by Glisery, Director of Graduate Admission, Bentley University.
Unsubscribe from Bentley University. <https://applygrad.bentley.edu/go?r=optout&mid=c9662441-9418-437e-a008-2845908753f0>

Dear Ayush,

You have less than a week to sign up for this free event!

Are you ready to unlock Power BI's full potential?

Our Data Modeling for Power BI Learn With The Nerds event will equip you with the skills needed to create efficient, scalable data models that drive better decision-making and deeper insights.

In this class, you’ll dive into the core concepts of data modeling, from building relationships to optimizing DAX for performance. Whether you’re a Power BI beginner or looking to sharpen your existing skills, this event will transform how you approach data analysis.

Why join us?

- Learn how to structure data for maximum efficiency
- Explore best practices in data modeling with real-world applications
- Get hands-on experience and expert-led instruction

This is your opportunity to gain the knowledge that sets you apart as a Power BI expert. Don’t miss out - register now to reserve your spot and take your data skills to the next level!

Learn With The Nerds

Data Modeling for Power BI [2024 Edition]

Thursday, October 24, 2024

11:00 AM - 2:00 PM Eastern Time (UTC -5)

Subject: ⚡️ Perplexity releases integrated enterprise knowledge search and team spaces
Message:
On Perplexity, Google, OpenAI, Anthropic, Local real-time voice AI
system, Yann Lecun and many more.. 

SIGNUP [1]  |  ADVERTISE [2]  |  FOLLOW ON X [3]  |  READ
ON WEB [4]

ALPHASIGNAL

 . 

HEY ,

Welcome to today's edition of AlphaSignal, a newsletter for developers
by developers.

We identify and summarize the top 1% news, papers, models, and repos
in the AI industry. 

IN TODAY'S SIGNAL

_Read time: 5 min 45 sec_

🎖️ TOP NEWS

 	*
Perplexity Introduces Internal Knowledge Search [5] for Enterprises

📌 PARTICLE

 	*
Learn how to develop the next generation of intelligent devices. Join
Particle and industry experts virtually on October 23rd [6].

⚡️ TRENDING SIGNALS

 	*
Google's NotebookLM introduces customizable [7] Audio Overviews,
allowing users to steer AI-generated content for specific needs.

 	*
OpenAI unveils ChatGPT Windows app [8], offering faster AI interaction
for Plus, Enterprise, Team users.

 	*
Ichigo-Llama3.1 open-source project is released [9] enabling local
voice AI with sub-second latency on consumer hardware.

 	*
Yann LeCun highlights new NYU study: [10] Feature prediction loss
outperforms reconstruction loss in self-supervised learning.

 	*
Anthropic releases updated Claude apps [11] for iOS and Android,
introducing projects support on mobile devices.

⚙️ TOP LECTURES

 	*
Build and deploy serverless AI agents [12] for customer support with
Amazon Bedrock from Andrew Ng's deeplearning.ai

 	*
Learn to get 95% discount on Claude 3.5 Sonnet [13] tokens by
combining prompt caching with the new Batches API.

 	*
Learn dynamic few-shot prompting with LlamaIndex [14] workflows for
enhanced LLM performance.

🧠 DEEP DIVE

 	*
Fine-tuning LLMs to 1.58-bit [15]: compress models without sacrificing
performance.

IF YOU'RE ENJOYING ALPHASIGNAL PLEASE FORWARD THIS EMAIL TO A
COLLEAGUE. 

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

Perplexity

PERPLEXITY INTRODUCES INTERNAL KNOWLEDGE SEARCH FOR ENTERPRISES

⇧ 1,773 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

Perplexity introduces Internal Knowledge Search and Spaces, enabling
simultaneous searches of organizational files and the web. This
feature addresses the need for a unified tool to access both internal
and external data, leveraging advanced LLMs like GPT-4 and Claude 3 to
enhance search efficiency and relevance. 

It integrates seamlessly into enterprise workflows, supporting up to
500 internal files accessible by all users within an organization.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

 	*
COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH: Combines internal and web data in a single
platform.

 	*
ADVANCED AI MODELS: Utilizes LLMs for improved data retrieval and
synthesis.

 	*
FILE CAPACITY: Supports up to 500 internal files for enterprise users.

 	*
COLLABORATION TOOLS: Includes Perplexity Spaces for team-based
research.

 	*
CUSTOMIZATION OPTIONS: Allows selection of AI models and custom
response settings.

PERPLEXITY SPACES AND ITS COLLABORATION FEATURES

Perplexity Spaces offers customizable AI-powered collaboration hubs,
allowing teams to upload persistent files, choose preferred AI models,
and set custom response instructions. This functionality supports
effective teamwork by providing a centralized location for organizing
research activities and sharing insights. Once you’ve set up your
Space, you can invite collaborators and connect internal files. Then
customize the AI assistant by choosing your preferred AI model and
setting specific instructions for how it should respond. 

Technical Specifications

The system uses advanced LLMs to ensure accurate and relevant search
results across varied data sources. It addresses potential issues like
data duplication or outdated information through user-driven file
selection and management. The technical requirements for
implementation are minimal, ensuring broad applicability across
different organizational environments.

Integration with Existing Systems

Internal Knowledge Search integrates with enterprise systems,
enhancing existing workflows without disrupting them. The feature's
design ensures compatibility with current enterprise infrastructure,
facilitating easy implementation.

		 READ MORE [5] 

		 [6] 

SPECTRA 2024: EXPLORE INTELLIGENCE FOR ANYTHING, ANYWHERE ON OCTOBER
23RD

Particle's annual virtual conference, Spectra, starts October 23rd.

The event focuses on "Intelligence for anything, anywhere" and
features key figures in edge computing.

Speakers include Pete Warden (Useful Sensors CEO, TensorFlow pioneer),
Zach Shelby and Jan Jongboom (Edge Impulse co-founders), Siddhika
Nevrekar (Qualcomm AI Hub), Pete Bernard (tinyML Foundation), Vijay
Janapa Reddi (MLCommons), Alasdair Allan (tech journalist), and Rick
Bullotta (industry advisor).

TOPICS COVERED

 	*
Embedding ML in devices while preserving privacy.

 	*
Critiquing AI gadgets like Humane Ai Pin and Rabbit R1, and

 	*
Optimizing development workflows.

Developers can gain insights to build the next generation of
intelligent products and cut through industry hype.

		 REGISTER FOR FREE [6] 

_partner with us [16]_

TRENDING SIGNALS

Google

GOOGLE'S NOTEBOOKLM INTRODUCES CUSTOMIZABLE AUDIO OVERVIEWS, ALLOWING
USERS TO STEER AI-GENERATED CONTENT FOR SPECIFIC NEEDS [7]

⇧ 1,619 Likes

OpenAI

OPENAI UNVEILS CHATGPT WINDOWS APP, OFFERING FASTER AI INTERACTION FOR
PLUS, ENTERPRISE, TEAM USERS [8]

⇧ 1,700 Likes

Voice AI

ICHIGO-LLAMA3.1 OPEN-SOURCE PROJECT IS RELEASED ENABLING LOCAL VOICE
AI WITH SUB-SECOND LATENCY ON CONSUMER HARDWARE [9]

⇧ 2,501 Likes

Computer Vision

YANN LECUN HIGHLIGHTS NEW NYU STUDY: FEATURE PREDICTION LOSS
OUTPERFORMS RECONSTRUCTION LOSS IN SELF-SUPERVISED LEARNING [10]

⇧ 2,800 Likes

Anthropic

ANTHROPIC RELEASES UPDATED CLAUDE APPS FOR IOS AND ANDROID,
INTRODUCING PROJECTS SUPPORT ON MOBILE DEVICES [11]

⇧ 1,488 Likes

TOP LECTURES

AI Agent

BUILD AND DEPLOY SERVERLESS AI AGENTS FOR CUSTOMER SUPPORT WITH AMAZON
BEDROCK FROM ANDREW NG'S DEEPLEARNING.AI [12]

⇧ 863 Likes

Learn to build serverless AI agents using Amazon Bedrock. You'll
create a customer service bot that answers queries, retrieves
information, and processes orders. The course covers integrating CRM
systems, implementing code interpreters for calculations, and setting
up guardrails to protect sensitive data. You'll deploy scalable,
responsible AI agents ready for real-world use.

Prompt caching

LEARN TO GET 95% DISCOUNT ON CLAUDE 3.5 SONNET TOKENS BY COMBINING
PROMPT CACHING WITH THE NEW BATCHES API [13]

⇧ 999 Likes

You'll learn about Anthropic's new Batch API pricing, offering up to
95% discounts on input tokens. We'll compare it with OpenAI's
offerings, explore combined caching and batching strategies, and
discuss implementation differences. You'll understand how to optimize
costs for large-scale LLM applications using these new pricing
structures.

Prompt Engineering

LEARN DYNAMIC FEW-SHOT PROMPTING WITH LLAMAINDEX WORKFLOWS FOR
ENHANCED LLM PERFORMANCE [14]

⇧ 313 Likes

You'll learn dynamic few-shot prompting using LlamaIndex workflows.
This technique retrieves relevant examples based on input queries,
improving LLM performance without full finetuning. You'll implement
this for customer support, text-to-SQL, and structured output tasks.
The approach uses retrieval-augmented generation, enhancing LLM
capabilities by leveraging growing knowledge bases. You'll use
LlamaIndex's workflow features for practical implementation.

TOP LECTURE

LLM Finetuning

FINE-TUNING LLMS TO 1.58-BIT: COMPRESS MODELS WITHOUT SACRIFICING
PERFORMANCE

⇧ 152 Likes

LLMs are growing larger, increasing computational and energy costs.
1.58-bit precision drastically reduces these costs by representing
each parameter with only three values: -1, 0, and 1. This extreme
quantization method can compress models significantly while
maintaining competitive performance.

HERE'S HOW YOU CAN FINE-TUNE LLMS TO 1.58-BIT PRECISION:

 	*
Start with a pre-trained model like Llama3 8B.

 	*
Replace standard Linear layers with BitLinear layers.

 	*
Implement a dynamic lambda scheduler for gradual quantization.

 	*
Use ternary weight quantization (-1, 0, 1) and 8-bit activation
quantization.

 	*
Apply the Straight Through Estimator (STE) for backpropagation.

 	*
Fine-tune on a large dataset (10B-100B tokens) with optimized learning
rates.

 	*
Implement custom CUDA or Triton kernels for efficient inference.

 	*
Evaluate performance using metrics like perplexity and MMLU scores.

In this blog, you'll learn to compress LLMs significantly while
maintaining competitive performance on downstream tasks.

		 READ THE BLOG [15]

Required Change:
We will be checking the following checkbox on your behalf. Please note that this checkbox is *REQUIRED* for all participants of HackUTD. If you do not consent to this, you may opt to delete your application at https://ripple.hackutd.co/profile ( https://ripple.hackutd.co/profile ).

Subject: The Standout Newsletter Vol. 23
Message:
Check out these five tips to make your job search easier and faster.

The Standout Newsletter Volume 23

Welcome to The Standout!

Family and friends often ask me to review their resumes, and in almost every case, they’re way too long. For example, my son’s resume is four pages long—and he’s only in college!

When it comes to resumes, longer is not better. You don’t need to tell your life story or list every job you’ve ever held.

Remember: The goal of your resume is to show that you’re the perfect fit for the job. This shouldn’t take more than 500 words (including your name and contact information).

Using a tool like Jobscan (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqFl3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3pZN4v_bJTSYwjLN8s_V39Mbr3GW2_wGp13l1cB1W6V2tYq2k5_rjW33Y35k26q30LW3_NL756t_m25W9kkrP33671rDW5NWgsw3Q1FvbN8wxZvjGwrhyW6T9LC094jRhDW4HD7Vd77Fj_WW5FxsJ81xb6tMW4jnP9_8pR45rV-vvqT9j8mByW35RDbs8nFnkTW8mGkXR1h9twgW940cJq8z_6R3W3fKpJ78xRX5zW3n865r4pn0J2N7hpRph9Zp62W54Dlbx1qb45HW8XpMR47QDm49f1gXxFd04 ) can help. First it analyzes the description of the job you’re applying to. Then it tells you which skills and qualifications to focus on.

By following Jobscan’s recommendations and keeping your resume under 500 words, you’ll increase your chances of getting an interview and landing that perfect job. 😎

Check out our latest podcast episode…

In this episode of The Standout Jobseeker, Sydney Myers interviews Michael Lord, the VP of Operations at 1-800-GOT-JUNK. Michael shares his inspiring career journey from starting at McDonald's to becoming a VP. Key topics include the importance of career growth through flexibility, the power of soft skills, balancing work with personal time, and the significance of ongoing learning.

You can listen to The Standout Jobseeker on Apple Podcasts (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqDs5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3mvW8KNDNQ4l57slVL_j9f4T8MTgW857FK-1STFH7W4FMLCh7j6vG9W8qvklR1td39_W4-ZZcd7gNGkJW3t431f42XsZqW3tQKq93zxZLDW4vFBKR2hPDbgW2QSm4R5-TqVzW40m_g75HzStnW5g4_nM24hkB6W4yGXk_5ZBrqLW3blsSP6qzJJSW2YgzmT93msX2W8DQnWt6SRbVdW2PZhRQ2-dDDnW5nSMJW3WJJlMW13zxxB5NS3FLW5PGF7x9l4YMHW5dVtk81L5k30W7Z3Kjm1c6ZbDW3N0hTC4bYmRjW5vGsGy6hHs4cN6FctBp7gLTVW97cW0F7jwmQdW6vZXjc91CxRRW8wxB8t1DV53rW51mKFn1X0PdRVMlfxv10mHZmW7W8-SM84Tj7fW1lBT8W7fT5PJf7H5Zwb04 ) , Spotify (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqFl5m_5PW6N1X8z6lZ3pkW94-ZPL6nfkfSN4hGmR4v03wVW1g09qg1FRpczW5f3d_j3cmsVvW854gV81tbmsFW28bLKD149981W5Spf2W5rzKKQW8xZ0QJ3vv1TwW27PZmK2QWLp9W5pnZWK6xjwNfW8Mw_yq2KxDQfW75k2rf7g3xRSW6MsLtT24G-ZdW844D-T20Ld__W6zRHDZ7yR7sRW4RQGHT7CqzXFW1XZtT44DRrRJVLxYgr3mxDbfW2nQt6B8J5BCWW39W_Sy6B6z7_W7zkwJs1c_s8CN7q9sjpvnn9VW3WgZDV8D50QZW8h1Q2h1qSS_MW9gQs5c3rbNVHW1cymS551f3BqN6Phcj3pgVjkW4BzVpy573YDtW2Jdwj-8YMskyVr4KrZ1n5NPMW5nJdQh9dqSMzVjfgbb3KfqzbVkqqLp92mdXPW37Fsql7W7HbXW9l_4mh5H1D95W3z-JDK7vRBJRW1K6HVF5CmfNbVY7Rfg4tcvkRf69tTwT04 ) , Amazon (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqDs7lxC-W50l5tj6lZ3lGW3SMhCM99WBlQW892L9f8XYM79W7Ltdp24Cgl9dW7xyQdD7gHnjcW92Qh6d8Q36kgW4HvBsX1vRMzNN6Vys0Tk34D-W5P82Rb6JvFtbN3k97YFS2dkDW4799Nn7f-st1M2j5Rzgj5KyW1CGv8l29x3xXVf9JXp5B_VJkN3L6yQVgsbVdW93pnc06s8z0TW536khh7FgC_3VV1Ghb66-nfHW5382v372xkhPW8Rml794r8dmmW2-2pb22zHMnRW7_wZWj5svV4XW8Tj3k325_sXBW32cKKx3JX3V8W7ykfpj4XNTprW5YCgJv8WJLZMM7s3sYTFct3W3FrwLs9ckhbdW4HtxD044s0yfW6JJWzk6pMZ4MW637q2Q4Q8yJSW12YY0X31TNzcW172QmD2287D1N665XrPgNh1BW5yPbSw4S86cgW42KkLN1yk7ktW2rhb-S2jN9JlW3f019-7DkypyW6R0Ssl4DXD1PN7n4rKztHtCsW8wQr4D9j91vsW7z7Dr05KltJKW66NT107bb81HVCsXRl5NkfP_N3ztMdqFm1KtW110Y015YK9WbV6zdrD8C6bXmW24XTlx9fn4KjW5b3qXW4rlsmmf4yG10404 ) , and pretty much everywhere else.

nl15-1 (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqFl5m_5PW6N1X8z6lZ3pkW94-ZPL6nfkfSN4hGmR4v03wVW1g09qg1FRpczW5f3d_j3cmsVvW854gV81tbmsFW28bLKD149981W5Spf2W5rzKKQW8xZ0QJ3vv1TwW27PZmK2QWLp9W5pnZWK6xjwNfW8Mw_yq2KxDQfW75k2rf7g3xRSW6MsLtT24G-ZdW844D-T20Ld__W6zRHDZ7yR7sRW4RQGHT7CqzXFW1XZtT44DRrRJVLxYgr3mxDbfW2nQt6B8J5BCWW39W_Sy6B6z7_W7zkwJs1c_s8CN7q9sjpvnn9VW3WgZDV8D50QZW8h1Q2h1qSS_MW9gQs5c3rbNVHW1cymS551f3BqN6Phcj3pgVjkW4BzVpy573YDtW2Jdwj-8YMskyVr4KrZ1n5NPMW5nJdQh9dqSMzVjfgbb3KfqzbVkqqLp92mdXPW37Fsql7W7HbXW9l_4mh5H1D95W3z-JDK7vRBJRW1K6HVF5CmfNbVY7Rfg4tcvkRf69tTwT04 )

In today’s edition of The Standout newsletter, we offer the following five tips to help make your job search easier and faster:

Here’s the first tip…

✍️ Write your resume summary last ✍️

Even though your resume summary appears near the top of your resume, try writing it last. This is because you'll have a clearer picture of your unique strengths after you've listed your experience, skills, and accomplishments. This approach makes it easier to write a strong resume summary, like this:

Next step: Check out Jobscan's Resume Summary Generator (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqFF3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3kQW96821C7pPp9mW2BpGrZ1t3tBWW4C3n9B8S9dn6W693ccq8PDhHzW91TPBZ2k9QBlW11FvRd7rPPHnW3jbVHc1-BbB2W8HQ0nH4CYFsQW1k_FNQ8xWDbNW41tlBR22LYNBW33BfDL9clMv1W65mX1D79t8BdW1HcC6s3qB8JLW8GfgKF9fMGdgW7yh14n3xmK39W7Dn8dD4xjHMRW76nSD41X4RV7W5vyfTc6PRQWhW400lQL3VqDHMW4M05D449KTzpW8cwnFB3MNy2fW7GXKt762f3k2W8LWS7k1V9LyjN55gHWYVZtGff89q5jd04 ) . With just one click, it creates a personalized summary based on your career background.

💪 How to overcome long-term unemployment 💪

If you’ve been out of work for a year or more, it’s important to frame your time off in a positive light. Share how you've grown during that period. Focus on the learning, knowledge, or skills you acquired, the volunteer activities you did, or the family responsibilities you managed.

Next step: For a list of employers committed to hiring the long-term unemployed, check out Hiring the Long-Term Unemployed (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqDs5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3pxW3RYHpl2Q141xW2vTcH19f7t2-W7hsfDW5DC6tMW3slLqz4KnTpJW2flKB586KtqxVm8fBz148S7pVY17vd3jRc0tN7wkp14MwNZJW6C4C0G6VFQw3W9ctfwq425cvxW3Nrtxz3Sr3GbVwRwD31Cy2v3V_78-W6TwrtTW4-YXXf8gn5LcW2bQ_sc8YV9cSW4czZtd45Wn8mW2xsK2K5tNGvyW5G7G_q3TxdlrW1QVYq09jc3K9W3vZC7R29bfjQW1RkPcN4cKwLlV4c5999jWg00W621hw55hhyJ7N3RGXMsGSJH3W1LzWPw49m6FtW1VZsRx124PkQW94vF242n1QqPW2QXRQc4wRts0N77LYS2qjrGpW4kp8hF3MGm8GVbQqmw1J6jgTW3PchFd53prpVf6jHGqj04 ) .

🏆 Take an online course that comes with a certificate 🏆

Many online courses come with certifications or badges that you can add to your resume or LinkedIn profile. Not only will you learn new skills, but these certifications show potential employers that you're committed to professional growth. Here’s how to add certifications to your resume:

Next step: For a list of free courses that come with free certifications, read 75+ Free Certifications to Help You Land Your Dream Job (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqFY3prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3lLW33vSNY41w_PGW3whpHt26ZnTmW5bCCg783RpChV4cCL67LVgxlW4X8sL96yZ35mW4958B9346WyHMwjdT0WHmlTW5CvH_J74HMQ-W3ZTJ6C1FJqN8W7NBB2y6GmwZ9N3Rrtjp88Y3rW4lg_0D4V6mlSN7ZK9YpqG9mxVqvx6s1s2GjwVZnTrx4KWy4_N108jLGXb4r2N8yDw7S9d9kFW4bL9hv8TFbSRW4GsBV42MCsBzW2blx2L3rZvkjW3L-kwv3rWWjKW1y03st5StXBPW3xNhrf4qQDpWW1cv_dV7MByf9W60Gxk52G09VBW8ZWMKX5kBt3df6n7Pp204 ) .

📄 Start a blog to boost your professional brand 📄

Having a blog is one of the best ways to show potential employers who you are and what you know. A blog can be a powerful branding tool that showcases your knowledge, passion, and communication skills. Always include a link to your blog on your resume and LinkedIn profile.

Next step: Choose a blogging platform like WordPress (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVMtvz8H7xGdW8nYHlh7lTWvYW5r_q0D5mgmP5N3ypqFl3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3psW3YBy1X6sthNGW5zK5jC81FPJ_W60-m3M8hg_8qN20yPVk5xJPxW8Z17Lk2ZNgNCW3LyhKK7982M3W2YrMy59fHrpXW99qzhc4WbfZ-W45fddm5LHH3fW6cnzbX8b3d7BW8n_G8w2CjCFlW9jD0s07ZWlcfW7DpSLK9cXBdpW6P_Z5M4p2jTTW4b3rv34LspQXW1KdbLS6xdtZXW4Wq_0h7KNsG3W8KNwxn1m3TzwW64gcDn14MYw3W42S7x47TH4cHVWV6Hx9cx7bjW4MM267842LN9f1rXyWH04 ) own article feature.

🤖 Use AI to personalize your outreach messages 🤖

To quickly create a personalized outreach message, go to the LinkedIn profile of your contact. Copy the profile, and then paste it into an AI tool like ChatGPT along with the prompt below. The tool will then generate a customized message. Here’s a prompt you can use:

Next step: Remember to review any AI-generated response to ensure it's accurate, appropriate, and reflects your authentic voice.

Join us for our next webinar…

When: Wednesday October 23, 2024 at 2:00 pm ET / 11:00 am PT

In this webinar, you'll learn:

- How to create an eye-catching headline to attract recruiters

Subject: Data Sharing Between Microservices
Message:
View this post on the web at https://blog.bytebytego.com/p/data-sharing-between-microservices

Microservices architecture has become popular for building complex, scalable software systems.
This architectural style structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled, independently deployable services. Each microservice is focused on a specific business capability and can be developed, deployed, and scaled independently.
While microservices offer numerous benefits, such as improved scalability, flexibility, and faster time to market, they also introduce significant challenges in terms of data management.
One of the fundamental principles of microservices architecture is that each service should own and manage its data. This principle is often expressed as "don't share databases between services” and it aims to ensure loose coupling and autonomy among services, allowing them to evolve independently. 
However, it's crucial to distinguish between sharing a data source and sharing data itself. While sharing a data source (e.g., a database) between services is discouraged, sharing data between services is often necessary and acceptable.
In this post, we’ll look at different ways of sharing data between microservices and the various advantages and disadvantages of specific approaches.

Ruchita Pathak shared a post: 📢 We're Hiring! Internship Opportunity at Hamro Patro.
Are you looking to gain hands-on experience in the dynamic world of e-commerce? We have an exciting paid internship opportunity for a dedicated individual to join our team and assist in fulfilling customer orders placed through our e-commerce platform.

Key Responsibilities:
- Process and fulfill customer orders efficiently.
- Coordinate with vendors to ensure timely delivery of products.
- Monitor order status and provide updates to customers.
- Collaborate with the team to maintain inventory records and ensure smooth operations.

What We're Looking For:
- Strong attention to detail.
- Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
- Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
- A passion for e-commerce and customer service.

Interested candidates can send their resumes to jobs@hamropatro.com
#Hiring #InternshipOpportunity #Ecommerce #PaidInternship #Nepal

Rocky Bhatia commented on Mayank Ahuja’s post: Design patterns are essential tools for scalable, maintainable systems, providing reusable solutions to common software challenges. They enhance code readability and promote modularity, enabling teams to work independently on components. Patterns like Factory streamline object creation while ensuring flexibility, while Strategy decouples algorithms for dynamic behavior changes at runtime. Singleton, often debated for overuse, ensures a single point of access but can introduce global state issues. Adapter and Proxy patterns play a crucial role in integrating legacy systems or managing remote access transparently. Mastering these patterns isn't just about memorization—it’s about recognizing when they align with system requirements for optimal efficiency and adaptability.

Subject: 🔥 New Mistral models outperform larger LLMs in sub-10B category
Message:
On Mistral AI, NVIDIA, Perplexity, Unsloth, Together AI and many
more.. 

SIGNUP [1]  |  ADVERTISE [2]  |  FOLLOW ON X [3]  |  READ
ON WEB [4]

ALPHASIGNAL

 . 

HEY ,

Welcome to today's edition of AlphaSignal, a newsletter for developers
by developers.

We identify and summarize the top 1% news, papers, models, and repos
in the AI industry. 

IN TODAY'S SIGNAL

_Read time: 5 min 50 sec_

🎖️ TOP NEWS

 	*
Mistral AI Introduces Ministral 3B and 8B [5] language models for Edge
Computing with strong  multilingual and reasoning performance.

📌 ORI

 	*
Reserve NVIDIA H200 GPU with Ori Global Cloud. [6] Get 141GB of VRAM.

⚡️ TRENDING SIGNALS

 	*
NVIDIA releases open-source Llama 3.1 70B fine-tune, [7] outperforming
GPT-4o and Claude 3.5 on benchmarks.

 	*
Lenovo unveils AI Now, [8] an on-device agent,  without cloud
reliance powered by Meta's Llama 3.1 for enhanced privacy.

 	*
Perplexity introduces AI-powered finance tool, [9] offering real-time
stock analysis and historical data for developers.

 	*
Unsloth fixes a universal issue in Gradient Accumulation [10] that
negatively impacted everyone's training of LLMs.

 	*
Together AI introduces LoLCATs [11]: Convert existing LLMs to
subquadratic variants at LoRA finetune cost.

📌 LAMBDA

 	*
Deploy new on demand  1x, 2x, and 4x NVIDIA H100 SXM [12] GPU
instances with Lambda.

📦 TOP HF MODELS

 	*
Aria: [13] efficient 3.9B parameter model for text, image, and video
processing.

 	*
F5-TTS: [14] non-autoregressive TTS model with multilingual zero-shot
capabilities.

 	*
DepthPro [15]: zero-shot depth prediction with boundary-preserving
accuracy and speed.

🧠 PYTORCH TIP

 	*
Identify bottlenecks in Pytorch models using profiler

IF YOU'RE ENJOYING ALPHASIGNAL PLEASE FORWARD THIS EMAIL TO A
COLLEAGUE. 

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

LLM

MISTRAL AI INTRODUCES MINISTRAL 3B AND 8B FOR EDGE COMPUTING

⇧ 1,773 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

Mistral AI has launched two new language models, Ministral 3B and
Ministral 8B, aimed at on-device computing and edge use cases. These
models set a new frontier in knowledge, commonsense, reasoning,
function-calling, and efficiency in the sub-10B category.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

 	*
Ministral 3B: Achieves scores of 60.9 on MMLU and 72.7 on Winogrande.

 	*
Ministral 8B: Scores 65.0 on MMLU and 75.3 on Winogrande,
demonstrating superior performance in multiple tasks.

 	*
Context Length: Both models support up to 128k context length.

 	*
Pricing: Ministral 3B is priced at $0.04/M tokens, while Ministral 8B
costs $0.1/M tokens.

USE CASES AND APPLICATIONS

These models cater to local, privacy-first inference needs for
applications such as on-device translation, internet-less smart
assistants, local analytics, and autonomous robotics. They offer a
compute-efficient and low-latency solution suitable for diverse users,
from hobbyists to large manufacturing teams. Additionally, they can be
integrated with larger models like Mistral Large to efficiently manage
multi-step workflows involving function-calling across various
contexts.

PERFORMANCE METRICS

 	*
For instance, Ministral 3B outperforms the larger Mistral 7B in most
benchmarks despite having fewer parameters.

 	*
Ministral 3B achieves notable accuracy in MMLU and Knowledge &
Commonsense tasks, outperforming models like Gemma 2 2B and LLaMA 3.2
3B.

 	*
Ministral 8B surpasses Mistral 7B in all categories, showcasing its
effectiveness in multilingual tasks and GSM8k Maj@8, reflecting its
advanced capabilities in reasoning and commonsense understanding.

AVAILABILITY AND LICENSING

Both models are available via API with commercial licenses. Model
weights for research use are accessible, and Mistral AI offers support
for lossless quantization to optimize performance for specific use
cases. These features make the models versatile tools for engineers
seeking efficient AI solutions in edge computing scenarios.

		 READ MORE [5] 

		 [6] 

CHART YOUR OWN AI REALITY WITH H200 INFRASTRUCTURE

NVIDIA just released the H200 GPU, now available for reservation
through Ori Global Cloud.

This GPU boasts 141GB of VRAM, optimized for resource-intensive AI
models and high-performance computing.

The H200 accelerates large-scale AI training and inference, offering
enhanced memory and processing power for developers.

AlphaSignal readers can now reserve the limited early access.

		 SECURE YOUR ACCESS [6] 

_partner with us [16]_

TRENDING SIGNALS

NVIDIA

NVIDIA RELEASES OPEN-SOURCE LLAMA 3.1 70B FINE-TUNE, OUTPERFORMING
GPT-4O AND CLAUDE 3.5 ON BENCHMARKS [7]

⇧ 8,777 Likes

Local LLM

LENOVO UNVEILS AI NOW, AN ON-DEVICE AGENT,  WITHOUT CLOUD RELIANCE
POWERED BY META'S LLAMA 3.1 FOR ENHANCED PRIVACY [8]

⇧ 582 Likes

LLM

PERPLEXITY INTRODUCES AI-POWERED FINANCE TOOL, OFFERING REAL-TIME
STOCK ANALYSIS AND HISTORICAL DATA FOR DEVELOPERS [9]

⇧ 5,011 Likes

LLM

UNSLOTH FIXES A UNIVERSAL ISSUE IN GRADIENT ACCUMULATION THAT
NEGATIVELY IMPACTED EVERYONE'S TRAINING OF LLMS [10]

⇧ 772 Likes

LLM

TOGETHER AI INTRODUCES LOLCATS: CONVERT EXISTING LLMS TO SUBQUADRATIC
VARIANTS AT LORA FINETUNE COST [11]

⇧ 266 Likes

NEW ON-DEMAND 1X, 2X, AND 4X NVIDIA H100 SXM GPU INSTANCES

Lambda just added new instances in their public cloud that deliver up
to 51% higher performance than PCIe models.

AI developers now have cheaper, flexible access to powerful compute
without needing full-node 8x setups.

GET YOUR INSTANCE [12]

TOP MODELS

SoTA Multimodal

ARIA [13]

⇧10,387 Downloads

Aria helps you build powerful multimodal AI applications. It processes
text, images, and videos with a 64K token context window.

THE MODEL OUTPERFORMS COMPETITORS ON VARIOUS BENCHMARKS

 	*
54.9% on MMMU (multimodal knowledge)

 	*
66.1% on MathVista (multimodal math)

 	*
92.6% on DocQA (document understanding)

 	*
65.3% on LongVideoBench (video comprehension)

 	*
73.2% on HumanEval (coding)

Aria uses 3.9B activated parameters per token, making it efficient and
fast. It's superior in video and document tasks.

Text-to-Speech

F5-TTS [14]

⇧ NA Downloads

F5-TTS helps you generate natural, expressive speech from text without
complex models. It's a non-autoregressive system using flow matching
and Diffusion Transformer.

KEY FEATURES

 	*
Faster training and inference (RTF 0.15) compared to other
diffusion-based TTS models

 	*
Zero-shot capability and seamless code-switching

 	*
Speed control efficiency

 	*
Trained on 100K hours of multilingual data

 	*
Uses ConvNeXt V2 for text representation

 	*
Introduces Sway Sampling for improved performance and efficiency

 	*
Fully open-source with released code and checkpoints

Computer Vision

DEPTHPRO [15]

⇧ NA Downloads

DepthPro helps you generate high-resolution, metric depth maps from
single RGB images in 0.3 seconds. It's a zero-shot model that produces
sharp, detailed depth estimates without camera metadata. 

KEY FEATURES:

 	*
2.25-megapixel output

 	*
Absolute scale depth prediction

 	*
Efficient multi-scale vision transformer architecture

 	*
Trained on real and synthetic data

 	*
New boundary accuracy metrics for depth maps

 	*
State-of-the-art focal length estimation

It outperforms previous models in speed and detail preservation,
particularly at object boundaries.

PYTORCH TIP

IDENTIFY BOTTLENECKS IN PYTORCH MODELS USING PROFILER

PyTorch Profiler helps you identify performance bottlenecks in your
deep learning models. You can track CPU and GPU usage, memory
consumption, and operator-level execution times. Use it when
optimizing model training or inference pipelines.

import torch
from torch.profiler import profile, record_function, ProfilerActivity

model = torch.nn.Linear(100, 100)
inputs = torch.randn(100, 100)

with profile(activities=[ProfilerActivity.CPU, 
                         ProfilerActivity.CUDA],
             record_shapes=True,
             profile_memory=True) as prof:
    with record_function("model_inference"):
        model(inputs)

print(prof.key_averages().table(sort_by="cpu_time_total", 
                                row_limit=10))

This code profiles a simple linear model. The profiler records CPU and
GPU activities, tensor shapes, and memory usage. The record_function
decorator labels specific code sections for easier analysis. This data
helps identify potential bottlenecks in even simple operations,
allowing developers to optimize their code for better efficiency.
CopyRetry

Benefits include faster model execution, reduced memory usage, and
improved hardware utilization. It's particularly useful for
large-scale models and production environments where efficiency is
crucial.

Subject: (Webinar) LinkedIn Optimization: How Job Seekers Are Getting Hired
Message:
Featuring Guest Speaker: Career coach, Bogdan Zlatkov 🌟

JS_Webinar_EmaillBanner_v4 (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVQLBN8MrlSxW4NWdF551Z6nwW8tMMP_5md5rXN3pwdFv3prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3mwW30YSx08pmKmDV6YKSq40cfjfW66Rtmh2dDfdsW53Hj5L2gbTQfW96wjC15yH645W7xsN_r4_T-kvW3w5hbD6kND7_TCdwH5mkRfbN8G1cnWlXb65W146p203mssrfW1N9xy-3_Y-GzW8p4B2R8MrBJ0W4b4ctZ4q6trSW8gQxsk8FK7BzVJjQxh91NnSBW366v9J1KKyRYW6Ksmxv3C7sQWW45b_hP7pJx3kW1G0MzF5zbQfdW1CRcK25B7RbkVqdHyq7Ks-rGN8s8rF7LcFPqW1cwRgl1qh42wW9kwqjy6dppKTW7YfCvd692q9mW8g1CdY1x_YSVW5PGM1k8-hd0CW22w2dz3nK5P7f6YxNg804 )

Hi ayush,

Jobscan's research has shown that 94% of recruiters use LinkedIn to source and vet job candidates. That means with a solid LinkedIn profile, your dream job might just come to you.

Join us and career coach, Bogdan Zlatkov, as we break down LinkedIn optimization tips, sharing how to create a profile that lands your next job.

In this webinar, you'll learn:

- How to create an eye-catching headline to attract recruiters
- The 4 essentials to include in your LinkedIn bio
- The best way to use LinkedIn search to find "fresh" jobs
- Tools to help you optimize your LinkedIn profile faster

And more!

Plus, we'll have an open Q&A where you can ask any questions you may have about your LinkedIn profile.

And - for the first 1,000 registrants, we're sharing a special offer - access to Bogdan's interview prep toolkit to help you ace your interviews.

Here are the webinar details:

When: Wednesday October 23, 2024 at 2:00pm ET / 11:00am PT

Where to register: Via this link (https://info.jobscan.co/e3t/Ctc/S+113/cvzDf04/VVQLBN8MrlSxW4NWdF551Z6nwW8tMMP_5md5rXN3pwdFv3prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3mwW30YSx08pmKmDV6YKSq40cfjfW66Rtmh2dDfdsW53Hj5L2gbTQfW96wjC15yH645W7xsN_r4_T-kvW3w5hbD6kND7_TCdwH5mkRfbN8G1cnWlXb65W146p203mssrfW1N9xy-3_Y-GzW8p4B2R8MrBJ0W4b4ctZ4q6trSW8gQxsk8FK7BzVJjQxh91NnSBW366v9J1KKyRYW6Ksmxv3C7sQWW45b_hP7pJx3kW1G0MzF5zbQfdW1CRcK25B7RbkVqdHyq7Ks-rGN8s8rF7LcFPqW1cwRgl1qh42wW9kwqjy6dppKTW7YfCvd692q9mW8g1CdY1x_YSVW5PGM1k8-hd0CW22w2dz3nK5P7f6YxNg804 ) (or the button below)

LinkedIn News Asia shared a post: “Being liked isn’t required for success — being respected is,” says founder and CEO Jingjin Liu.

The likability trap is self-sabotage. The most impactful women in history weren't always liked — they were bold, decisive, and unapologetic. Instead of playing nice, they focused on changing the game, Liu adds.

❓How can you avoid falling into the likability trap? Share your thoughts in the comments.

#IOTD #success #advise #mindset

Deerwalk Institute of Technology shared a post: 𝗕𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵 𝗧𝗿𝗲𝗸 | 𝗖𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟯

Celebrating the connections formed through shared learning, the 𝗕𝗦𝗰.𝗖𝗦𝗜𝗧 𝗖𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟯 came together for an unforgettable trek. This time, the BSc.CSIT Class of 2023 chose 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗻𝗴 for their journey.

The trek transformed into a journey of joy, exploration, and unity, leaving a lasting imprint on the hearts of the Class of 2023.

As they say goodbye to their academic adventure, the bonds formed and the memories created will echo in their hearts for years to come. Here's to the shared experiences that shaped them, the lasting friendships that define them, and the bright future ahead.

We wish all the students great success in their upcoming journeys.

#dwit #BScCSIT #BatchTrek #ClassOf2023 #UnforgettableJourney #SharedExperiences

Institute for Integrated Development Studies (IIDS) shared a post: *Happening this Friday*

The Center for Strategic Affairs at IIDS is organizing ‘Ideating @ IIDS - Episode 04' on Friday, 18th October, 2024. 

In this exclusive session, we are honored to host H.E. Dr. Thomas Prinz, German Ambassador to Nepal. Moderated by Mr. Akhilesh Upadhyay, Senior IIDS Fellow, this event will explore the ambassador's experiences in Nepal, his dedicated efforts to strengthen bilateral ties, and examine the Nepali diaspora residing in Germany, along with potential collaboration opportunities in the future.

The Tau Beta Pi Association, Inc. shared a post: We are proud of the Tau Beta Pi faculty and staff at Iowa State University (ISU) who received awards in 2024! Cyclone Engineering, the engineering program at ISU, recognizes outstanding faculty and staff each year who have demonstrated their commitment to the land-grant ideals of learning, discovery and engagement.

The Early Achievement in Research award, which recognizes a faculty member who has demonstrated outstanding accomplishments in research and/or creative activity unusually early in their professional career, was awarded to Dr. Roy E. Sturgill Jr., P.E., VA B ’07, assistant professor of civil, construction and environmental engineering at ISU. He has served on over 30 projects totaling over five million dollars worth of research and is the Committee Chair for the Transportation Research Board (TRB) Standing Committee on Utilities.

Dr. Anuj Sharma, Ph.D., IN A ’07, received the Mid-Career Achievement in Research award, which recognizes faculty members who have demonstrated outstanding accomplishments in research and/or creative activity at the mid-career stage. He is a PITT-DES MOINES, INC. professor in civil engineering, research scientist with the Institute for Transportation and associate director of the TrAC - Translational AI Center. Dr. Sharma’s work leading research at the REACTOR-HPC (REaltime AnalytiCs of TranspORtation date - High Performance Cluster) laboratory, along with a memorandum of understanding with Iowa Department of Transportation, has placed ISU among one of the very few facilities in the US transportation arena using big data analytics.

Congratulations to these impressive engineers for their wide range of accomplishments in their professional careers!

Message:
Dear HackUTD Travel Reimbursement Applicants,

This is a friendly reminder that travel reimbursement forms are due tomorrow night. E *ach individual team member* must submit a separate travel reimbursement application (ie. 4 people → 4 applications).
You can expect to hear back by the end of next week. Please ensure that all members of your team have submitted their application by then.
Best,

Welcome to today's edition of AlphaSignal, a newsletter for developers
by developers.

We identify and summarize the top 1% news, papers, models, and repos
in the AI industry.

Outperforming Current 7B Leaders.

creation in Premiere Pro.

outperforming models 7x its size.

highlighting need for robust evaluation in production.

and reproducibility.

mlc-llml [12]: Universal LLM Deployment Engine with ML Compilation.

surya: [13] OCR, layout analysis, reading order, table recognition in
90+ languages.

TEN-Agent: [14] world’s first real-time multimodal agent integrated
with the OpenAI Realtime API, RTC, and features weather checks, web
search, vision, and RAG capabilities.

🧠 LECTURE

 	*
Andrej Karpathy on AI evolution [15]: from self-driving cars to AGI.

IF YOU'RE ENJOYING ALPHASIGNAL PLEASE FORWARD THIS EMAIL TO A
COLLEAGUE. 

It helps us keep this content free.

TOP NEWS

Hybrid-SSM model

ZYPHRA RELEASES ZAMBA2-7B: A HYBRID SSM-ATTENTION MODEL OUTPERFORMING
CURRENT 7B LEADERS

⇧ 965 Likes

WHAT'S NEW

Zyphra has unveiled Zamba2-7B, a 7 billion parameter language model
that combines Mamba2 blocks with shared attention layers. This
open-source model surpasses other leading models in the ≤8B
parameter range, including Mistral-7B, Gemma-7B, and Llama3-8B, in
both quality and inference speed.

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

 	*
Outperforms Mistral-7B, Gemma-7B, and Llama3-8B in benchmarks

 	*
25% faster time to first token, 20% higher tokens per second than
Llama3-8B

 	*
Trained on 3 trillion tokens with 100B token "annealing" phase

 	*
Open-source under Apache 2.0 license

 	*
Instruct-tuned version available

ARCHITECTURE 

 	*
The Zamba2-7B architecture features a backbone of Mamba2 layers
interspersed with two shared attention layers in an ABAB pattern.

 	*
This design allocates more parameters to the Mamba2 backbone while
preserving cross-sequence dependencies.

 	*
LoRA projectors applied to shared MLPs allow for depth-specific
specialization.

ZAMBA2-7B INFERENCE PERFORMANCE

 	*
SOTA inference efficiency, including latency, throughput and memory
usage.

 	*
Roughly 4 times the throughput of an equal-parameter transformer
block.

 	*
One of the key reason for such performance is that Mamba blocks only
have small hidden states to store and don't require a KV-cache. The
model only stores KV states for shared attention block invocations,
reducing memory usage.

TRAINING DETAILS

 	*
The model's training involved a 3 trillion token dataset, followed by
a 100 billion token "annealing" phase using high-quality data. This
approach contributes to its strong performance on a per-training-token
basis and across standard benchmarks for the ≤8B parameter class.

 	*
The training process utilized 128 H100 GPUs over approximately 50
days, employing Zyphra's internal framework built on Megatron-LM. This
demonstrates the feasibility of pushing the 7B scale frontier with
moderate resources.

ACCESS AND AVAILABILITY
Developers can access Zamba2-7B through Huggingface and also from
NVIDIA’s NIM site. The model is designed for on-device use and
consumer GPUs, making it accessible for various applications.

		 READ MORE [5] 

		 [6] 

LEARN FROM NVIDIA, HP, DATABRICKS, AND MORE

Nvidia, HP, Databricks, ServiceNow, and Twilio just announced the
premier conference for GenAI:

 	*
Designing GenAI stacks for enterprise scale

 	*
AI governance, evaluation, and observability strategies

 	*
Production-ready GenAI app best practices

Developers can now access these key learnings to enhance their AI
implementations and workflows.

		 FREE REGISTRATION [6] 

_partner with us [16]_

CREATION IN PREMIERE PRO [7]

⇧ 1,727 Likes

GOOGLE INTRODUCES NEW GEMINI API PARAMETERS, ENHANCING CONTROL AND
REPRODUCIBILITY [11]

⇧ 1,200 Likes

TRENDING REPOS

LLM Deployment

MLC-LLML [12]

☆ 18,910 Stars

This repo helps you deploy LLMs across diverse hardware: GPUs (NVIDIA,
AMD, Apple, Intel), CPUs, and web browsers. It uses ML compilation to
optimize performance. You can run models like Llama 2 and Vicuna on
your chosen device with OpenAI-compatible APIs.

OCR

SURYA [13]

☆ 11,200 Stars

helps you do OCR, text detection, layout analysis, reading order
detection, and table recognition for documents. It works in 90+
languages with high accuracy. You can process PDFs and images. It
outperforms Tesseract in text detection (82.1% vs 63.1% precision) and
matches Google Cloud Vision in OCR accuracy (97% similarity). The
models use modified EfficientViT and Donut architectures, trained on
diverse datasets. You can install it with pip and use it via CLI,
Python API, or a Streamlit GUI.

Code Manager

TEN-AGENT [14]

☆ 711 Stars

helps you build high-performance multimodal AI applications with
real-time interactions. You can integrate OpenAI's Realtime API, RTC,
and custom extensions in C++, Go, or Python. It supports edge-cloud
deployment, multi-language processing, and real-time agent state
management. The drag-and-drop interface simplifies complex AI system
creation, combining audio-visual tools, databases, and RAG.

LECTURE

AI Evolution

ANDREJ KARPATHY ON AI EVOLUTION: FROM SELF-DRIVING CARS TO AGI

⇧ 5,600 Likes

Andrej Karpathy, former Tesla Autopilot leader and OpenAI founding
member, shares insights on AI's evolution in a No Priors podcast
interview. He discusses the shift from traditional programming to
"Software 2.0", where neural networks and data define software
behavior. 

He talks about on the importance of extremely smaller-sized distilled
models where even 1Bn param model should be useful enough.

Karpathy explores vision-based approaches in self-driving cars,
drawing parallels between autonomous vehicles and potential AGI
development. He emphasizes data's crucial role in modern software and
AI's impact on various sectors.

IN THIS DISCUSSION, YOU'LL LEARN ABOUT

 	*
Parallels between human cognition and AI models

 	*
Building high performance small models

 	*
Software 2.0 concept and its implications

 	*
Vision-based AI systems in autonomous driving

 	*
Comparison of Tesla and Waymo approaches

 	*
AGI development parallels with self-driving tech

 	*
AI's economic impact, particularly on transaction costs

 	*
Data's role as the new 'code' in AI-driven software

 	*
AI's potential in reshaping education and productivity

Subject: How Uber Manages Petabytes of Real-Time Data
Message:
View this post on the web at https://blog.bytebytego.com/p/how-uber-manages-petabytes-of-real

Stop renting auth. Make it yours instead.(Sponsored) [ https://substack.com/redirect/5da46259-60b4-4c34-ad71-4b9e4188dda4?j=eyJ1IjoiNGttZjFjIn0.gcsUzE5NXaGUueZCDXoZj_4qIXulgaasToHhJaZqz5Y ]
